2157
2158/*!
2159 \since 4.6
2160
2161 Sets the selection area to \a path. All items within this area are
2162 immediately selected, and all items outside are unselected. You can get
2163 the list of all selected items by calling selectedItems().
2164
2165 \a deviceTransform is the transformation that applies to the view, and needs to
2166 be provided if the scene contains items that ignore transformations.
2167
2168 For an item to be selected, it must be marked as \e selectable
2169 (QGraphicsItem::ItemIsSelectable).
2170
2171 \sa clearSelection(), selectionArea()
2172*/
2173void QGraphicsScene::setSelectionArea(const QPainterPath &path, const QTransform &deviceTransform)
2174{
2175 setSelectionArea(path, selectionOperation: Qt::ReplaceSelection, mode: Qt::IntersectsItemShape, deviceTransform);
2176}
2177
2178/*!
2179 \overload
2180 \since 5.5
2181
2182 Sets the selection area to \a path using \a mode to determine if items are
2183 included in the selection area.
2184
2185 \a deviceTransform is the transformation that applies to the view, and needs to
2186 be provided if the scene contains items that ignore transformations.
2187
2188 \a selectionOperation determines what to do with the currently selected items.
2189
2190 \sa clearSelection(), selectionArea()
2191*/
2192void QGraphicsScene::setSelectionArea(const QPainterPath &path,
2193 Qt::ItemSelectionOperation selectionOperation,
2194 Qt::ItemSelectionMode mode,
2195 const QTransform &deviceTransform)
2196{
2197 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
2198
2199 // Note: with boolean path operations, we can improve performance here
2200 // quite a lot by "growing" the old path instead of replacing it. That
2201 // allows us to only check the intersect area for changes, instead of
2202 // reevaluating the whole path over again.
2203 d->selectionArea = path;
2204
2205 QSet<QGraphicsItem *> unselectItems = d->selectedItems;
2206
2207 // Disable emitting selectionChanged() for individual items.
2208 ++d->selectionChanging;
2209 bool changed = false;
2210
2211 // Set all items in path to selected.
2212 const auto items = this->items(path, mode, order: Qt::DescendingOrder, deviceTransform);
2213 for (QGraphicsItem *item : items) {
2214 if (item->flags() & QGraphicsItem::ItemIsSelectable) {
2215 if (!item->isSelected())
2216 changed = true;
2217 unselectItems.remove(value: item);
2218 item->setSelected(true);
2219 }
2220 }
2221
2222 switch (selectionOperation) {
2223 case Qt::ReplaceSelection:
2224 // Deselect all items outside path.
2225 for (QGraphicsItem *item : std::as_const(t&: unselectItems)) {
2226 item->setSelected(false);
2227 changed = true;
2228 }
2229 break;
2230 default:
2231 break;
2232 }
2233
2234 // Re-enable emitting selectionChanged() for individual items.
2235 --d->selectionChanging;
2236
2237 if (!d->selectionChanging && changed)
2238 emit selectionChanged();
2239}
2240
2241/*!
2242 Clears the current selection.
2243
2244 \sa setSelectionArea(), selectedItems()
2245*/
2246void QGraphicsScene::clearSelection()
2247{
2248 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
2249
2250 // Disable emitting selectionChanged
2251 ++d->selectionChanging;
2252 // iterate over a copy, as clearing selection might invalidate selectedItems
2253 const auto selectedItems = d->selectedItems;
2254 QSet<QGraphicsItem *> stillSelectedSet;
2255
2256 for (QGraphicsItem *item : selectedItems) {
2257 item->setSelected(false);
2258 // items might override itemChange to prevent deselection
2259 if (item->isSelected())
2260 stillSelectedSet << item;
2261 }
2262 const bool changed = stillSelectedSet != selectedItems;
2263 d->selectedItems = stillSelectedSet;
2264
2265 // Re-enable emitting selectionChanged() for individual items.
2266 --d->selectionChanging;
2267
2268 if (!d->selectionChanging && changed)
2269 emit selectionChanged();
2270}
2271
2272/*!
2273 \since 4.4
2274
2275 Removes and deletes all items from the scene, but otherwise leaves the
2276 state of the scene unchanged.
2277
2278 \sa addItem()
2279*/
2280void QGraphicsScene::clear()
2281{
2282 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
2283 // NB! We have to clear the index before deleting items; otherwise the
2284 // index might try to access dangling item pointers.
2285 d->index->clear();
2286 // NB! QGraphicsScenePrivate::unregisterTopLevelItem() removes items
2287 while (!d->topLevelItems.isEmpty())
2288 delete d->topLevelItems.first();
2289 Q_ASSERT(d->topLevelItems.isEmpty());
2290 d->lastItemCount = 0;
2291 d->allItemsIgnoreHoverEvents = true;
2292 d->allItemsUseDefaultCursor = true;
2293 d->allItemsIgnoreTouchEvents = true;
2294 d->focusOnTouch = true;
2295}
2296
2297/*!
2298 Groups all items in \a items into a new QGraphicsItemGroup, and returns a
2299 pointer to the group. The group is created with the common ancestor of \a
2300 items as its parent, and with position (0, 0). The items are all
2301 reparented to the group, and their positions and transformations are
2302 mapped to the group. If \a items is empty, this function will return an
2303 empty top-level QGraphicsItemGroup.
2304
2305 QGraphicsScene has ownership of the group item; you do not need to delete
2306 it. To dismantle (ungroup) a group, call destroyItemGroup().
2307
2308 \sa destroyItemGroup(), QGraphicsItemGroup::addToGroup()
2309*/
2310QGraphicsItemGroup *QGraphicsScene::createItemGroup(const QList<QGraphicsItem *> &items)
2311{
2312 // Build a list of the first item's ancestors
2313 QList<QGraphicsItem *> ancestors;
2314 int n = 0;
2315 if (!items.isEmpty()) {
2316 QGraphicsItem *parent = items.at(i: n++);
2317 while ((parent = parent->parentItem()))
2318 ancestors.append(t: parent);
2319 }
2320
2321 // Find the common ancestor for all items
2322 QGraphicsItem *commonAncestor = nullptr;
2323 if (!ancestors.isEmpty()) {
2324 while (n < items.size()) {
2325 int commonIndex = -1;
2326 QGraphicsItem *parent = items.at(i: n++);
2327 do {
2328 int index = ancestors.indexOf(t: parent, from: qMax(a: 0, b: commonIndex));
2329 if (index != -1) {
2330 commonIndex = index;
2331 break;
2332 }
2333 } while ((parent = parent->parentItem()));
2334
2335 if (commonIndex == -1) {
2336 commonAncestor = nullptr;
2337 break;
2338 }
2339
2340 commonAncestor = ancestors.at(i: commonIndex);
2341 }
2342 }
2343
2344 // Create a new group at that level
2345 QGraphicsItemGroup *group = new QGraphicsItemGroup(commonAncestor);
2346 if (!commonAncestor)
2347 addItem(item: group);
2348 for (QGraphicsItem *item : items)
2349 group->addToGroup(item);
2350 return group;
2351}
2352
2353/*!
2354 Reparents all items in \a group to \a group's parent item, then removes \a
2355 group from the scene, and finally deletes it. The items' positions and
2356 transformations are mapped from the group to the group's parent.
2357
2358 \sa createItemGroup(), QGraphicsItemGroup::removeFromGroup()
2359*/
2360void QGraphicsScene::destroyItemGroup(QGraphicsItemGroup *group)
2361{
2362 const auto items = group->childItems();
2363 for (QGraphicsItem *item : items)
2364 group->removeFromGroup(item);
2365 removeItem(item: group);
2366 delete group;
2367}
2368
2369/*!
2370 Adds or moves the \a item and all its children to this scene.
2371 This scene takes ownership of the \a item.
2372
2373 If the item is visible (i.e., QGraphicsItem::isVisible() returns
2374 true), QGraphicsScene will emit changed() once control goes back
2375 to the event loop.
2376
2377 If the item is already in a different scene, it will first be
2378 removed from its old scene, and then added to this scene as a
2379 top-level.
2380
2381 QGraphicsScene will send ItemSceneChange notifications to \a item
2382 while it is added to the scene. If item does not currently belong
2383 to a scene, only one notification is sent. If it does belong to
2384 scene already (i.e., it is moved to this scene), QGraphicsScene
2385 will send an addition notification as the item is removed from its
2386 previous scene.
2387
2388 If the item is a panel, the scene is active, and there is no
2389 active panel in the scene, then the item will be activated.
2390
2391 \sa removeItem(), addEllipse(), addLine(), addPath(), addPixmap(),
2392 addRect(), addText(), addWidget(), {QGraphicsItem#Sorting}{Sorting}
2393*/
2394void QGraphicsScene::addItem(QGraphicsItem *item)
2395{
2396 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
2397 if (!item) {
2398 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsScene::addItem: cannot add null item");
2399 return;
2400 }
2401 if (item->d_ptr->scene == this) {
2402 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsScene::addItem: item has already been added to this scene");
2403 return;
2404 }
2405 // Remove this item from its existing scene
2406 if (QGraphicsScene *oldScene = item->d_ptr->scene)
2407 oldScene->removeItem(item);
2408
2409 // Notify the item that its scene is changing, and allow the item to
2410 // react.
2411 const QVariant newSceneVariant(item->itemChange(change: QGraphicsItem::ItemSceneChange,
2412 value: QVariant::fromValue<QGraphicsScene *>(value: this)));
2413 QGraphicsScene *targetScene = qvariant_cast<QGraphicsScene *>(v: newSceneVariant);
2414 if (targetScene != this) {
2415 if (targetScene && item->d_ptr->scene != targetScene)
2416 targetScene->addItem(item);
2417 return;
2418 }
2419
2420 // QDeclarativeItems do not rely on initial itemChanged message, as the componentComplete
2421 // function allows far more opportunity for delayed-construction optimization.
2422 if (!item->d_ptr->isDeclarativeItem) {
2423 if (d->unpolishedItems.isEmpty()) {
2424 QMetaMethod method = metaObject()->method(index: d->polishItemsIndex);
2425 method.invoke(obj: this, c: Qt::QueuedConnection);
2426 }
2427 d->unpolishedItems.append(t: item);
2428 item->d_ptr->pendingPolish = true;
2429 }
2430
2431 // Detach this item from its parent if the parent's scene is different
2432 // from this scene.
2433 if (QGraphicsItem *itemParent = item->d_ptr->parent) {
2434 if (itemParent->d_ptr->scene != this)
2435 item->setParentItem(nullptr);
2436 }
2437
2438 // Add the item to this scene
2439 item->d_func()->scene = targetScene;
2440
2441 // Add the item in the index
2442 d->index->addItem(item);
2443
2444 // Add to list of toplevels if this item is a toplevel.
2445 if (!item->d_ptr->parent)
2446 d->registerTopLevelItem(item);
2447
2448 // Add to list of items that require an update. We cannot assume that the
2449 // item is fully constructed, so calling item->update() can lead to a pure
2450 // virtual function call to boundingRect().
2451 d->markDirty(item);
2452 d->dirtyGrowingItemsBoundingRect = true;
2453
2454 // Disable selectionChanged() for individual items
2455 ++d->selectionChanging;
2456 int oldSelectedItemSize = d->selectedItems.size();
2457
2458 // Enable mouse tracking if we haven't already done so, and the item needs it.
2459 // We cannot use itemAcceptsHoverEvents_helper() here, since we need to enable
2460 // mouse tracking also if this item is temporarily blocked by a modal panel.
2461
2462 auto needsMouseTracking = [](const QGraphicsItemPrivate *item) {
2463 return item->acceptsHover
2464 || (item->isWidget && static_cast<const QGraphicsWidgetPrivate *>(item)->hasDecoration());
2465 };
2466
2467 if (d->allItemsIgnoreHoverEvents && needsMouseTracking(item->d_ptr.data())) {
2468 d->allItemsIgnoreHoverEvents = false;
2469 d->enableMouseTrackingOnViews();
2470 }
2471#ifndef QT_NO_CURSOR
2472 if (d->allItemsUseDefaultCursor && item->d_ptr->hasCursor) {
2473 d->allItemsUseDefaultCursor = false;
2474 if (d->allItemsIgnoreHoverEvents) // already enabled otherwise
2475 d->enableMouseTrackingOnViews();
2476 }
2477#endif //QT_NO_CURSOR
2478
2479 // Enable touch events if the item accepts touch events.
2480 if (d->allItemsIgnoreTouchEvents && item->d_ptr->acceptTouchEvents) {
2481 d->allItemsIgnoreTouchEvents = false;
2482 d->enableTouchEventsOnViews();
2483 }
2484
2485#ifndef QT_NO_GESTURES
2486 for (auto it = item->d_ptr->gestureContext.constBegin();
2487 it != item->d_ptr->gestureContext.constEnd(); ++it)
2488 d->grabGesture(item, gesture: it.key());
2489#endif
2490
2491 // Update selection lists
2492 if (item->isSelected())
2493 d->selectedItems << item;
2494 if (item->isWidget() && item->isVisible() && static_cast<QGraphicsWidget *>(item)->windowType() == Qt::Popup)
2495 d->addPopup(widget: static_cast<QGraphicsWidget *>(item));
2496 if (item->isPanel() && item->isVisible() && item->panelModality() != QGraphicsItem::NonModal)
2497 d->enterModal(item);
2498
2499 // Update creation order focus chain. Make sure to leave the widget's
2500 // internal tab order intact.
2501 if (item->isWidget()) {
2502 QGraphicsWidget *widget = static_cast<QGraphicsWidget *>(item);
2503 if (!d->tabFocusFirst) {
2504 // No first tab focus widget - make this the first tab focus
2505 // widget.
2506 d->tabFocusFirst = widget;
2507 } else if (!widget->parentWidget() && !widget->isPanel()) {
2508 // Adding a widget that is not part of a tab focus chain.
2509 QGraphicsWidget *myNewPrev = d->tabFocusFirst->d_func()->focusPrev;
2510 myNewPrev->d_func()->focusNext = widget;
2511 widget->d_func()->focusPrev->d_func()->focusNext = d->tabFocusFirst;
2512 d->tabFocusFirst->d_func()->focusPrev = widget->d_func()->focusPrev;
2513 widget->d_func()->focusPrev = myNewPrev;
2514 }
2515 }
2516
2517 // Add all children recursively
2518 item->d_ptr->ensureSortedChildren();
2519 for (auto child : std::as_const(t&: item->d_ptr->children))
2520 addItem(item: child);
2521
2522 // Resolve font and palette.
2523 item->d_ptr->resolveFont(inheritedMask: d->font.resolveMask());
2524 item->d_ptr->resolvePalette(inheritedMask: d->palette.resolveMask());
2525
2526
2527 // Re-enable selectionChanged() for individual items
2528 --d->selectionChanging;
2529 if (!d->selectionChanging && d->selectedItems.size() != oldSelectedItemSize)
2530 emit selectionChanged();
2531
2532 // Deliver post-change notification
2533 item->itemChange(change: QGraphicsItem::ItemSceneHasChanged, value: newSceneVariant);
2534
2535 // Update explicit activation
2536 bool autoActivate = true;
2537 if (!d->childExplicitActivation && item->d_ptr->explicitActivate)
2538 d->childExplicitActivation = item->d_ptr->wantsActive ? 1 : 2;
2539 if (d->childExplicitActivation && item->isPanel()) {
2540 if (d->childExplicitActivation == 1)
2541 setActivePanel(item);
2542 else
2543 autoActivate = false;
2544 d->childExplicitActivation = 0;
2545 } else if (!item->d_ptr->parent) {
2546 d->childExplicitActivation = 0;
2547 }
2548
2549 // Auto-activate this item's panel if nothing else has been activated
2550 if (autoActivate) {
2551 if (!d->lastActivePanel && !d->activePanel && item->isPanel()) {
2552 if (isActive())
2553 setActivePanel(item);
2554 else
2555 d->lastActivePanel = item;
2556 }
2557 }
2558
2559 if (item->d_ptr->flags & QGraphicsItem::ItemSendsScenePositionChanges)
2560 d->registerScenePosItem(item);
2561
2562 // Ensure that newly added items that have subfocus set, gain
2563 // focus automatically if there isn't a focus item already.
2564 if (!d->focusItem && item != d->lastFocusItem && item->focusItem() == item)
2565 item->focusItem()->setFocus();
2566
2567 d->updateInputMethodSensitivityInViews();
2568}

2807/*!
2808 Removes the item \a item and all its children from the scene. The
2809 ownership of \a item is passed on to the caller (i.e.,
2810 QGraphicsScene will no longer delete \a item when destroyed).
2811
2812 \sa addItem()
2813*/
2814void QGraphicsScene::removeItem(QGraphicsItem *item)
2815{
2816 // ### Refactoring: This function shares much functionality with _q_removeItemLater()
2817 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
2818 if (!item) {
2819 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsScene::removeItem: cannot remove 0-item");
2820 return;
2821 }
2822 if (item->scene() != this) {
2823 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsScene::removeItem: item %p's scene (%p)"
2824 " is different from this scene (%p)",
2825 item, item->scene(), this);
2826 return;
2827 }
2828
2829 // Notify the item that it's scene is changing to 0, allowing the item to
2830 // react.
2831 const QVariant newSceneVariant(item->itemChange(change: QGraphicsItem::ItemSceneChange,
2832 value: QVariant::fromValue<QGraphicsScene *>(value: 0)));
2833 QGraphicsScene *targetScene = qvariant_cast<QGraphicsScene *>(v: newSceneVariant);
2834 if (targetScene != nullptr && targetScene != this) {
2835 targetScene->addItem(item);
2836 return;
2837 }
2838
2839 d->removeItemHelper(item);
2840
2841 // Deliver post-change notification
2842 item->itemChange(change: QGraphicsItem::ItemSceneHasChanged, value: newSceneVariant);
2843
2844 d->updateInputMethodSensitivityInViews();
2845}

2848 When the scene is active, this functions returns the scene's current focus
2849 item, or \nullptr if no item currently has focus. When the scene is inactive,
2850 this functions returns the item that will gain input focus when the scene
2851 becomes active.
2852
2853 The focus item receives keyboard input when the scene receives a
2854 key event.

2856 \sa setFocusItem(), QGraphicsItem::hasFocus(), isActive()

2866 focusReason, after removing focus from any previous item that may have had
2867 focus.
2868
2869 If \a item is \nullptr, or if it either does not accept focus (i.e., it does not
2870 have the QGraphicsItem::ItemIsFocusable flag enabled), or is not visible

2874 If item is not \nullptr, and the scene does not currently have focus (i.e.,
2875 hasFocus() returns \c false), this function will call setFocus()

2902/*!
2903 Sets focus on the scene by sending a QFocusEvent to the scene, passing \a
2904 focusReason as the reason. If the scene regains focus after having
2905 previously lost it while an item had focus, the last focus item will
2906 receive focus with \a focusReason as the reason.
2907
2908 If the scene already has focus, this function does nothing.
2909
2910 \sa hasFocus(), clearFocus(), setFocusItem()
2911*/
2912void QGraphicsScene::setFocus(Qt::FocusReason focusReason)
2913{
2914 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
2915 if (d->hasFocus || !isActive())
2916 return;
2917 QFocusEvent event(QEvent::FocusIn, focusReason);
2918 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: this, event: &event);
2919}

2921/*!
2922 Clears focus from the scene. If any item has focus when this function is
2923 called, it will lose focus, and regain focus again once the scene regains
2924 focus.
2925
2926 A scene that does not have focus ignores key events.
2927
2928 \sa hasFocus(), setFocus(), setFocusItem()
2929*/
2930void QGraphicsScene::clearFocus()
2931{
2932 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
2933 if (d->hasFocus) {
2934 d->hasFocus = false;
2935 d->passiveFocusItem = d->focusItem;
2936 setFocusItem(item: nullptr, focusReason: Qt::OtherFocusReason);
2937 }
2938}

2940/*!
2941 \property QGraphicsScene::stickyFocus
2942 \brief whether clicking into the scene background will clear focus
2943
2944 \since 4.6
2945
2946 In a QGraphicsScene with stickyFocus set to true, focus will remain
2947 unchanged when the user clicks into the scene background or on an item
2948 that does not accept focus. Otherwise, focus will be cleared.
2949
2950 By default, this property is \c false.
2951
2952 Focus changes in response to a mouse press. You can reimplement
2953 mousePressEvent() in a subclass of QGraphicsScene to toggle this property
2954 based on where the user has clicked.
2955
2956 \sa clearFocus(), setFocusItem()
2957*/

2968
2969/*!
2970 Returns the current mouse grabber item, or \nullptr if no item is
2971 currently grabbing the mouse. The mouse grabber item is the item
2972 that receives all mouse events sent to the scene.
2973
2974 An item becomes a mouse grabber when it receives and accepts a
2975 mouse press event, and it stays the mouse grabber until either of
2976 the following events occur:
2977
2978 \list
2979 \li If the item receives a mouse release event when there are no other
2980 buttons pressed, it loses the mouse grab.
2981 \li If the item becomes invisible (i.e., someone calls \c {item->setVisible(false)}),
2982 or if it becomes disabled (i.e., someone calls \c {item->setEnabled(false)}),
2983 it loses the mouse grab.
2984 \li If the item is removed from the scene, it loses the mouse grab.
2985 \endlist
2986
2987 If the item loses its mouse grab, the scene will ignore all mouse events
2988 until a new item grabs the mouse (i.e., until a new item receives a mouse
2989 press event).
2990*/
2991QGraphicsItem *QGraphicsScene::mouseGrabberItem() const
2992{
2993 Q_D(const QGraphicsScene);
2994 return !d->mouseGrabberItems.isEmpty() ? d->mouseGrabberItems.last() : 0;
2995}

3063
3064/*!
3065 This method is used by input methods to query a set of properties of
3066 the scene to be able to support complex input method operations as support
3067 for surrounding text and reconversions.
3068
3069 The \a query parameter specifies which property is queried.
3070
3071 \sa QWidget::inputMethodQuery()
3072*/
3073QVariant QGraphicsScene::inputMethodQuery(Qt::InputMethodQuery query) const
3074{
3075 Q_D(const QGraphicsScene);
3076 if (!d->focusItem || !(d->focusItem->flags() & QGraphicsItem::ItemAcceptsInputMethod))
3077 return QVariant();
3078 const QTransform matrix = d->focusItem->sceneTransform();
3079 QVariant value = d->focusItem->inputMethodQuery(query);
3080 if (value.userType() == QMetaType::QRectF)
3081 value = matrix.mapRect(value.toRectF());
3082 else if (value.userType() == QMetaType::QPointF)
3083 value = matrix.map(p: value.toPointF());
3084 else if (value.userType() == QMetaType::QRect)
3085 value = matrix.mapRect(value.toRect());
3086 else if (value.userType() == QMetaType::QPoint)
3087 value = matrix.map(p: value.toPoint());
3088 return value;
3089}
3090
3091/*!
3092 \fn void QGraphicsScene::update(const QRectF &rect)
3093 Schedules a redraw of the area \a rect on the scene.
3094
3095 \sa sceneRect(), changed()
3096*/
3097void QGraphicsScene::update(const QRectF &rect)
3098{
3099 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
3100 if (d->updateAll || (rect.isEmpty() && !rect.isNull()))
3101 return;
3102
3103 // Check if anyone's connected; if not, we can send updates directly to
3104 // the views. Otherwise or if there are no views, use old behavior.
3105 bool directUpdates = !(d->isSignalConnected(signalIdx: d->changedSignalIndex)) && !d->views.isEmpty();
3106 if (rect.isNull()) {
3107 d->updateAll = true;
3108 d->updatedRects.clear();
3109 if (directUpdates) {
3110 // Update all views.
3111 for (auto view : std::as_const(t&: d->views))
3112 view->d_func()->fullUpdatePending = true;
3113 }
3114 } else {
3115 if (directUpdates) {
3116 // Update all views.
3117 for (auto view : std::as_const(t&: d->views)) {
3118 if (view->isTransformed())
3119 view->d_func()->updateRectF(rect: view->viewportTransform().mapRect(rect));
3120 else
3121 view->d_func()->updateRectF(rect);
3122 }
3123 } else {
3124 d->updatedRects.insert(x: rect);
3125 }
3126 }
3127
3128 if (!d->calledEmitUpdated) {
3129 d->calledEmitUpdated = true;
3130 QMetaObject::invokeMethod(obj: this, member: "_q_emitUpdated", c: Qt::QueuedConnection);
3131 }
3132}

3134/*!
3135 \fn void QGraphicsScene::update(qreal x, qreal y, qreal w, qreal h)
3136 \overload
3137 \since 4.3
3138
3139 This function is equivalent to calling update(QRectF(\a x, \a y, \a w,
3140 \a h));
3141*/
3142
3143/*!
3144 Invalidates and schedules a redraw of the \a layers in \a rect on the
3145 scene. Any cached content in \a layers is unconditionally invalidated and
3146 redrawn.
3147
3148 You can use this function overload to notify QGraphicsScene of changes to
3149 the background or the foreground of the scene. This function is commonly
3150 used for scenes with tile-based backgrounds to notify changes when
3151 QGraphicsView has enabled
3152 \l{QGraphicsView::CacheBackground}{CacheBackground}.
3153
3154 Example:
3155
3156 \snippet code/src_gui_graphicsview_qgraphicsscene.cpp 5
3157
3158 Note that QGraphicsView currently supports background caching only (see
3159 QGraphicsView::CacheBackground). This function is equivalent to calling
3160 update() if any layer but BackgroundLayer is passed.
3161
3162 \sa QGraphicsView::resetCachedContent()
3163*/
3164void QGraphicsScene::invalidate(const QRectF &rect, SceneLayers layers)
3165{
3166 const auto views_ = views();
3167 for (QGraphicsView *view : views_)
3168 view->invalidateScene(rect, layers);
3169 update(rect);
3170}

3192/*!
3193 This slot \e advances the scene by one step, by calling
3194 QGraphicsItem::advance() for all items on the scene. This is done in two
3195 phases: in the first phase, all items are notified that the scene is about
3196 to change, and in the second phase all items are notified that they can
3197 move. In the first phase, QGraphicsItem::advance() is called passing a
3198 value of 0 as an argument, and 1 is passed in the second phase.
3199
3200 Note that you can also use the \l{The Animation Framework}{Animation
3201 Framework} for animations.
3202
3203 \sa QGraphicsItem::advance(), QTimeLine
3204*/
3205void QGraphicsScene::advance()
3206{
3207 for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
3208 const auto items_ = items();
3209 for (QGraphicsItem *item : items_)
3210 item->advance(phase: i);
3211 }
3212}
3213
3214/*!
3215 Processes the event \a event, and dispatches it to the respective
3216 event handlers.
3217
3218 In addition to calling the convenience event handlers, this
3219 function is responsible for converting mouse move events to hover
3220 events for when there is no mouse grabber item. Hover events are
3221 delivered directly to items; there is no convenience function for
3222 them.
3223
3224 Unlike QWidget, QGraphicsScene does not have the convenience functions
3225 \l{QWidget::}{enterEvent()} and \l{QWidget::}{leaveEvent()}. Use this
3226 function to obtain those events instead.
3227
3228 Returns \c true if \a event has been recognized and processed; otherwise,
3229 returns \c false.
3230
3231 \sa contextMenuEvent(), keyPressEvent(), keyReleaseEvent(),
3232 mousePressEvent(), mouseMoveEvent(), mouseReleaseEvent(),
3233 mouseDoubleClickEvent(), focusInEvent(), focusOutEvent()
3234*/
3235bool QGraphicsScene::event(QEvent *event)
3236{
3237 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
3238
3239 switch (event->type()) {
3240 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneMousePress:
3241 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneMouseMove:
3242 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneMouseRelease:
3243 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneMouseDoubleClick:
3244 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneHoverEnter:
3245 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneHoverLeave:
3246 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneHoverMove:
3247 case QEvent::TouchBegin:
3248 case QEvent::TouchUpdate:
3249 case QEvent::TouchEnd:
3250 // Reset the under-mouse list to ensure that this event gets fresh
3251 // item-under-mouse data. Be careful about this list; if people delete
3252 // items from inside event handlers, this list can quickly end up
3253 // having stale pointers in it. We need to clear it before dispatching
3254 // events that use it.
3255 // ### this should only be cleared if we received a new mouse move event,
3256 // which relies on us fixing the replay mechanism in QGraphicsView.
3257 d->cachedItemsUnderMouse.clear();
3258 default:
3259 break;
3260 }
3261
3262 switch (event->type()) {
3263 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneDragEnter:
3264 dragEnterEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *>(event));
3265 break;
3266 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneDragMove:
3267 dragMoveEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *>(event));
3268 break;
3269 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneDragLeave:
3270 dragLeaveEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *>(event));
3271 break;
3272 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneDrop:
3273 dropEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *>(event));
3274 break;
3275 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneContextMenu:
3276 contextMenuEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneContextMenuEvent *>(event));
3277 break;
3278 case QEvent::KeyPress:
3279 if (!d->focusItem) {
3280 QKeyEvent *k = static_cast<QKeyEvent *>(event);
3281 if (k->key() == Qt::Key_Tab || k->key() == Qt::Key_Backtab) {
3282 if (!(k->modifiers() & (Qt::ControlModifier | Qt::AltModifier))) { //### Add MetaModifier?
3283 bool res = false;
3284 if (k->key() == Qt::Key_Backtab
3285 || (k->key() == Qt::Key_Tab && (k->modifiers() & Qt::ShiftModifier))) {
3286 res = focusNextPrevChild(next: false);
3287 } else if (k->key() == Qt::Key_Tab) {
3288 res = focusNextPrevChild(next: true);
3289 }
3290 if (!res)
3291 event->ignore();
3292 return true;
3293 }
3294 }
3295 }
3296 keyPressEvent(event: static_cast<QKeyEvent *>(event));
3297 break;
3298 case QEvent::KeyRelease:
3299 keyReleaseEvent(event: static_cast<QKeyEvent *>(event));
3300 break;
3301 case QEvent::ShortcutOverride: {
3302 QGraphicsItem *parent = focusItem();
3303 while (parent) {
3304 d->sendEvent(item: parent, event);
3305 if (event->isAccepted())
3306 return true;
3307 parent = parent->parentItem();
3308 }
3309 }
3310 return false;
3311 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneMouseMove:
3312 {
3313 QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *mouseEvent = static_cast<QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *>(event);
3314 d->lastSceneMousePos = mouseEvent->scenePos();
3315 mouseMoveEvent(event: mouseEvent);
3316 break;
3317 }
3318 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneMousePress:
3319 mousePressEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *>(event));
3320 break;
3321 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneMouseRelease:
3322 mouseReleaseEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *>(event));
3323 break;
3324 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneMouseDoubleClick:
3325 mouseDoubleClickEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *>(event));
3326 break;
3327 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneWheel:
3328 wheelEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneWheelEvent *>(event));
3329 break;
3330 case QEvent::FocusIn:
3331 focusInEvent(event: static_cast<QFocusEvent *>(event));
3332 break;
3333 case QEvent::FocusOut:
3334 focusOutEvent(event: static_cast<QFocusEvent *>(event));
3335 break;
3336 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneHoverEnter:
3337 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneHoverLeave:
3338 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneHoverMove:
3339 {
3340 QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent *hoverEvent = static_cast<QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent *>(event);
3341 d->lastSceneMousePos = hoverEvent->scenePos();
3342 d->dispatchHoverEvent(hoverEvent);
3343 break;
3344 }
3345 case QEvent::Leave:
3346 Q_ASSERT_X(false, "QGraphicsScene::event",
3347 "QGraphicsScene must not receive QEvent::Leave, use GraphicsSceneLeave");
3348 break;
3349 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneLeave:
3350 {
3351 auto *leaveEvent = static_cast<QGraphicsSceneEvent*>(event);
3352 d->leaveScene(viewport: leaveEvent->widget());
3353 break;
3354 }
3355 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneHelp:
3356 helpEvent(event: static_cast<QGraphicsSceneHelpEvent *>(event));
3357 break;
3358 case QEvent::InputMethod:
3359 inputMethodEvent(event: static_cast<QInputMethodEvent *>(event));
3360 break;
3361 case QEvent::WindowActivate:
3362 if (!d->activationRefCount++) {
3363 if (d->lastActivePanel) {
3364 // Activate the last panel.
3365 d->setActivePanelHelper(item: d->lastActivePanel, duringActivationEvent: true);
3366 } else if (d->tabFocusFirst && d->tabFocusFirst->isPanel()) {
3367 // Activate the panel of the first item in the tab focus
3368 // chain.
3369 d->setActivePanelHelper(item: d->tabFocusFirst, duringActivationEvent: true);
3370 } else {
3371 // Activate all toplevel items.
3372 QEvent event(QEvent::WindowActivate);
3373 const auto items_ = items();
3374 for (QGraphicsItem *item : items_) {
3375 if (item->isVisible() && !item->isPanel() && !item->parentItem())
3376 sendEvent(item, event: &event);
3377 }
3378 }
3379 }
3380 break;
3381 case QEvent::WindowDeactivate:
3382 if (!--d->activationRefCount) {
3383 if (d->activePanel) {
3384 // Deactivate the active panel (but keep it so we can
3385 // reactivate it later).
3386 QGraphicsItem *lastActivePanel = d->activePanel;
3387 d->setActivePanelHelper(item: nullptr, duringActivationEvent: true);
3388 d->lastActivePanel = lastActivePanel;
3389 } else {
3390 // Activate all toplevel items.
3391 QEvent event(QEvent::WindowDeactivate);
3392 const auto items_ = items();
3393 for (QGraphicsItem *item : items_) {
3394 if (item->isVisible() && !item->isPanel() && !item->parentItem())
3395 sendEvent(item, event: &event);
3396 }
3397 }
3398 }
3399 break;
3400 case QEvent::ApplicationFontChange: {
3401 // Resolve the existing scene font.
3402 d->resolveFont();
3403 break;
3404 }
3405 case QEvent::FontChange:
3406 // Update the entire scene when the font changes.
3407 update();
3408 break;
3409 case QEvent::ApplicationPaletteChange: {
3410 // Resolve the existing scene palette.
3411 d->resolvePalette();
3412 break;
3413 }
3414 case QEvent::PaletteChange:
3415 // Update the entire scene when the palette changes.
3416 update();
3417 break;
3418 case QEvent::StyleChange:
3419 // Reresolve all widgets' styles. Update all top-level widgets'
3420 // geometries that do not have an explicit style set.
3421 update();
3422 break;
3423 case QEvent::StyleAnimationUpdate:
3424 // Because QGraphicsItem is not a QObject, QStyle driven
3425 // animations are forced to update the whole scene
3426 update();
3427 break;
3428 case QEvent::TouchBegin:
3429 case QEvent::TouchUpdate:
3430 case QEvent::TouchEnd:
3431 d->touchEventHandler(touchEvent: static_cast<QTouchEvent *>(event));
3432 break;
3433#ifndef QT_NO_GESTURES
3434 case QEvent::Gesture:
3435 case QEvent::GestureOverride:
3436 d->gestureEventHandler(event: static_cast<QGestureEvent *>(event));
3437 break;
3438#endif // QT_NO_GESTURES
3439 default:
3440 return QObject::event(event);
3441 }
3442 return true;
3443}
3444
3445/*!
3446 \reimp
3447
3448 QGraphicsScene filters QApplication's events to detect palette and font
3449 changes.
3450*/
3451bool QGraphicsScene::eventFilter(QObject *watched, QEvent *event)
3452{
3453 if (watched != qApp)
3454 return false;
3455
3456 switch (event->type()) {
3457 case QEvent::ApplicationPaletteChange:
3458 QCoreApplication::postEvent(receiver: this, event: new QEvent(QEvent::ApplicationPaletteChange));
3459 break;
3460 case QEvent::ApplicationFontChange:
3461 QCoreApplication::postEvent(receiver: this, event: new QEvent(QEvent::ApplicationFontChange));
3462 break;
3463 default:
3464 break;
3465 }
3466 return false;
3467}

3469/*!
3470 This event handler, for event \a contextMenuEvent, can be reimplemented in
3471 a subclass to receive context menu events. The default implementation
3472 forwards the event to the topmost visible item that accepts context menu events at
3473 the position of the event. If no items accept context menu events at this
3474 position, the event is ignored.
3475
3476 Note: See items() for a definition of which items are considered visible by this function.
3477
3478 \sa QGraphicsItem::contextMenuEvent()
3479*/
3480void QGraphicsScene::contextMenuEvent(QGraphicsSceneContextMenuEvent *contextMenuEvent)
3481{
3482 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
3483 // Ignore by default.
3484 contextMenuEvent->ignore();
3485
3486 // Send the event to all items at this position until one item accepts the
3487 // event.
3488 const auto items = d->itemsAtPosition(screenPos: contextMenuEvent->screenPos(),
3489 scenePos: contextMenuEvent->scenePos(),
3490 widget: contextMenuEvent->widget());
3491 for (QGraphicsItem *item : items) {
3492 contextMenuEvent->setPos(item->d_ptr->genericMapFromScene(pos: contextMenuEvent->scenePos(),
3493 viewport: contextMenuEvent->widget()));
3494 contextMenuEvent->accept();
3495 if (!d->sendEvent(item, event: contextMenuEvent))
3496 break;
3497
3498 if (contextMenuEvent->isAccepted())
3499 break;
3500 }
3501}

3503/*!
3504 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented in a subclass
3505 to receive drag enter events for the scene.
3506
3507 The default implementation accepts the event and prepares the scene to
3508 accept drag move events.
3509
3510 \sa QGraphicsItem::dragEnterEvent(), dragMoveEvent(), dragLeaveEvent(),
3511 dropEvent()
3512*/
3513void QGraphicsScene::dragEnterEvent(QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *event)
3514{
3515 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
3516 d->dragDropItem = nullptr;
3517 d->lastDropAction = Qt::IgnoreAction;
3518 event->accept();
3519}
3520
3521/*!
3522 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented in a subclass
3523 to receive drag move events for the scene.
3524
3525 Note: See items() for a definition of which items are considered visible by this function.
3526
3527 \sa QGraphicsItem::dragMoveEvent(), dragEnterEvent(), dragLeaveEvent(),
3528 dropEvent()
3529*/
3530void QGraphicsScene::dragMoveEvent(QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *event)
3531{
3532 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
3533 event->ignore();
3534
3535 if (!d->mouseGrabberItems.isEmpty()) {
3536 // Mouse grabbers that start drag events lose the mouse grab.
3537 d->clearMouseGrabber();
3538 d->mouseGrabberButtonDownPos.clear();
3539 d->mouseGrabberButtonDownScenePos.clear();
3540 d->mouseGrabberButtonDownScreenPos.clear();
3541 }
3542
3543 bool eventDelivered = false;
3544
3545 // Find the topmost enabled items under the cursor. They are all
3546 // candidates for accepting drag & drop events.
3547 const auto items = d->itemsAtPosition(screenPos: event->screenPos(),
3548 scenePos: event->scenePos(),
3549 widget: event->widget());
3550 for (QGraphicsItem *item : items) {
3551 if (!item->isEnabled() || !item->acceptDrops())
3552 continue;
3553
3554 if (item != d->dragDropItem) {
3555 // Enter the new drag drop item. If it accepts the event, we send
3556 // the leave to the parent item.
3557 QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent dragEnter(QEvent::GraphicsSceneDragEnter);
3558 d->cloneDragDropEvent(dest: &dragEnter, source: event);
3559 dragEnter.setDropAction(event->proposedAction());
3560 d->sendDragDropEvent(item, dragDropEvent: &dragEnter);
3561 event->setAccepted(dragEnter.isAccepted());
3562 event->setDropAction(dragEnter.dropAction());
3563 if (!event->isAccepted()) {
3564 // Propagate to the item under
3565 continue;
3566 }
3567
3568 d->lastDropAction = event->dropAction();
3569
3570 if (d->dragDropItem) {
3571 // Leave the last drag drop item. A perfect implementation
3572 // would set the position of this event to the point where
3573 // this event and the last event intersect with the item's
3574 // shape, but that's not easy to do. :-)
3575 QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent dragLeave(QEvent::GraphicsSceneDragLeave);
3576 d->cloneDragDropEvent(dest: &dragLeave, source: event);
3577 d->sendDragDropEvent(item: d->dragDropItem, dragDropEvent: &dragLeave);
3578 }
3579
3580 // We've got a new drag & drop item
3581 d->dragDropItem = item;
3582 }
3583
3584 // Send the move event.
3585 event->setDropAction(d->lastDropAction);
3586 event->accept();
3587 d->sendDragDropEvent(item, dragDropEvent: event);
3588 if (event->isAccepted())
3589 d->lastDropAction = event->dropAction();
3590 eventDelivered = true;
3591 break;
3592 }
3593
3594 if (!eventDelivered) {
3595 if (d->dragDropItem) {
3596 // Leave the last drag drop item
3597 QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent dragLeave(QEvent::GraphicsSceneDragLeave);
3598 d->cloneDragDropEvent(dest: &dragLeave, source: event);
3599 d->sendDragDropEvent(item: d->dragDropItem, dragDropEvent: &dragLeave);
3600 d->dragDropItem = nullptr;
3601 }
3602 // Propagate
3603 event->setDropAction(Qt::IgnoreAction);
3604 }
3605}
3606
3607/*!
3608 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented in a subclass
3609 to receive drag leave events for the scene.
3610
3611 \sa QGraphicsItem::dragLeaveEvent(), dragEnterEvent(), dragMoveEvent(),
3612 dropEvent()
3613*/
3614void QGraphicsScene::dragLeaveEvent(QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *event)
3615{
3616 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
3617 if (d->dragDropItem) {
3618 // Leave the last drag drop item
3619 d->sendDragDropEvent(item: d->dragDropItem, dragDropEvent: event);
3620 d->dragDropItem = nullptr;
3621 }
3622}
3623
3624/*!
3625 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented in a subclass
3626 to receive drop events for the scene.
3627
3628 \sa QGraphicsItem::dropEvent(), dragEnterEvent(), dragMoveEvent(),
3629 dragLeaveEvent()
3630*/
3631void QGraphicsScene::dropEvent(QGraphicsSceneDragDropEvent *event)
3632{
3633 Q_UNUSED(event);
3634 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
3635 if (d->dragDropItem) {
3636 // Drop on the last drag drop item
3637 d->sendDragDropEvent(item: d->dragDropItem, dragDropEvent: event);
3638 d->dragDropItem = nullptr;
3639 }
3640}
3641
3642/*!
3643 This event handler, for event \a focusEvent, can be reimplemented in a
3644 subclass to receive focus in events.
3645
3646 The default implementation sets focus on the scene, and then on the last
3647 focus item.
3648
3649 \sa QGraphicsItem::focusOutEvent()
3650*/
3651void QGraphicsScene::focusInEvent(QFocusEvent *focusEvent)
3652{
3653 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
3654
3655 d->hasFocus = true;
3656 switch (focusEvent->reason()) {
3657 case Qt::TabFocusReason:
3658 if (!focusNextPrevChild(next: true))
3659 focusEvent->ignore();
3660 break;
3661 case Qt::BacktabFocusReason:
3662 if (!focusNextPrevChild(next: false))
3663 focusEvent->ignore();
3664 break;
3665 default:
3666 if (d->passiveFocusItem) {
3667 // Set focus on the last focus item
3668 setFocusItem(item: d->passiveFocusItem, focusReason: focusEvent->reason());
3669 }
3670 break;
3671 }
3672}
3673
3674/*!
3675 This event handler, for event \a focusEvent, can be reimplemented in a
3676 subclass to receive focus out events.
3677
3678 The default implementation removes focus from any focus item, then removes
3679 focus from the scene.
3680
3681 \sa QGraphicsItem::focusInEvent()
3682*/
3683void QGraphicsScene::focusOutEvent(QFocusEvent *focusEvent)
3684{
3685 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
3686 d->hasFocus = false;
3687 d->passiveFocusItem = d->focusItem;
3688 setFocusItem(item: nullptr, focusReason: focusEvent->reason());
3689
3690 // Remove all popups when the scene loses focus.
3691 if (!d->popupWidgets.isEmpty())
3692 d->removePopup(widget: d->popupWidgets.constFirst());
3693}

3695/*!
3696 This event handler, for event \a helpEvent, can be
3697 reimplemented in a subclass to receive help events. The events
3698 are of type QEvent::ToolTip, which are created when a tooltip is
3699 requested.
3700
3701 The default implementation shows the tooltip of the topmost
3702 visible item, i.e., the item with the highest z-value, at the mouse
3703 cursor position. If no item has a tooltip set, this function
3704 does nothing.
3705
3706 Note: See items() for a definition of which items are considered visible by this function.
3707
3708 \sa QGraphicsItem::toolTip(), QGraphicsSceneHelpEvent
3709*/
3710void QGraphicsScene::helpEvent(QGraphicsSceneHelpEvent *helpEvent)
3711{
3712#if !QT_CONFIG(tooltip)
3713 Q_UNUSED(helpEvent);
3714#else
3715 // Find the first item that does tooltips
3716 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
3717 const QList<QGraphicsItem *> itemsAtPos = d->itemsAtPosition(screenPos: helpEvent->screenPos(),
3718 scenePos: helpEvent->scenePos(),
3719 widget: helpEvent->widget());
3720 QGraphicsItem *toolTipItem = nullptr;
3721 for (auto item : itemsAtPos) {
3722 if (item->d_func()->isProxyWidget()) {
3723 // if the item is a proxy widget, the event is forwarded to it
3724 sendEvent(item, event: helpEvent);
3725 if (helpEvent->isAccepted())
3726 return;
3727 }
3728 if (!item->toolTip().isEmpty()) {
3729 toolTipItem = item;
3730 break;
3731 }
3732 }
3733
3734 // Show or hide the tooltip
3735 QString text;
3736 QPoint point;
3737 if (toolTipItem && !toolTipItem->toolTip().isEmpty()) {
3738 text = toolTipItem->toolTip();
3739 point = helpEvent->screenPos();
3740 }
3741 QToolTip::showText(pos: point, text, w: helpEvent->widget());
3742 helpEvent->setAccepted(!text.isEmpty());
3743#endif
3744}
3745
3746bool QGraphicsScenePrivate::itemAcceptsHoverEvents_helper(const QGraphicsItem *item) const
3747{
3748 return (item->d_ptr->acceptsHover
3749 || (item->d_ptr->isWidget
3750 && static_cast<const QGraphicsWidget *>(item)->d_func()->hasDecoration()))
3751 && !item->isBlockedByModalPanel();
3752}
3753
3754/*!
3755 This event handler, for event \a hoverEvent, can be reimplemented in a
3756 subclass to receive hover enter events. The default implementation
3757 forwards the event to the topmost visible item that accepts hover events at the
3758 scene position from the event.
3759
3760 Note: See items() for a definition of which items are considered visible by this function.
3761
3762 \sa QGraphicsItem::hoverEvent(), QGraphicsItem::setAcceptHoverEvents()
3763*/
3764bool QGraphicsScenePrivate::dispatchHoverEvent(QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent *hoverEvent)
3765{
3766 if (allItemsIgnoreHoverEvents)
3767 return false;
3768
3769 // Find the first item that accepts hover events, reusing earlier
3770 // calculated data is possible.
3771 if (cachedItemsUnderMouse.isEmpty()) {
3772 cachedItemsUnderMouse = itemsAtPosition(screenPos: hoverEvent->screenPos(),
3773 scenePos: hoverEvent->scenePos(),
3774 widget: hoverEvent->widget());
3775 }
3776
3777 QGraphicsItem *item = nullptr;
3778 for (auto tmp : std::as_const(t&: cachedItemsUnderMouse)) {
3779 if (itemAcceptsHoverEvents_helper(item: tmp)) {
3780 item = tmp;
3781 break;
3782 }
3783 }
3784
3785 // Find the common ancestor item for the new topmost hoverItem and the
3786 // last item in the hoverItem list.
3787 QGraphicsItem *commonAncestorItem = (item && !hoverItems.isEmpty()) ? item->commonAncestorItem(other: hoverItems.constLast()) : nullptr;
3788 while (commonAncestorItem && !itemAcceptsHoverEvents_helper(item: commonAncestorItem))
3789 commonAncestorItem = commonAncestorItem->parentItem();
3790 if (commonAncestorItem && commonAncestorItem->panel() != item->panel()) {
3791 // The common ancestor isn't in the same panel as the two hovered
3792 // items.
3793 commonAncestorItem = nullptr;
3794 }
3795
3796 // Check if the common ancestor item is known.
3797 int index = commonAncestorItem ? hoverItems.indexOf(t: commonAncestorItem) : -1;
3798 // Send hover leaves to any existing hovered children of the common
3799 // ancestor item.
3800 for (int i = hoverItems.size() - 1; i > index; --i) {
3801 QGraphicsItem *lastItem = hoverItems.takeLast();
3802 if (itemAcceptsHoverEvents_helper(item: lastItem))
3803 sendHoverEvent(type: QEvent::GraphicsSceneHoverLeave, item: lastItem, hoverEvent);
3804 }
3805
3806 // Item is a child of a known item. Generate enter events for the
3807 // missing links.
3808 QList<QGraphicsItem *> parents;
3809 QGraphicsItem *parent = item;
3810 while (parent && parent != commonAncestorItem) {
3811 parents.append(t: parent);
3812 if (parent->isPanel()) {
3813 // Stop at the panel - we don't deliver beyond this point.
3814 break;
3815 }
3816 parent = parent->parentItem();
3817 }
3818 for (auto it = parents.crbegin(), end = parents.crend(); it != end; ++it) {
3819 QGraphicsItem *parent = *it;
3820 hoverItems << parent;
3821 if (itemAcceptsHoverEvents_helper(item: parent))
3822 sendHoverEvent(type: QEvent::GraphicsSceneHoverEnter, item: parent, hoverEvent);
3823 }
3824
3825 // Generate a move event for the item itself
3826 if (item
3827 && !hoverItems.isEmpty()
3828 && item == hoverItems.constLast()) {
3829 sendHoverEvent(type: QEvent::GraphicsSceneHoverMove, item, hoverEvent);
3830 return true;
3831 }
3832 return false;
3833}
3834
3835/*!
3836 \internal
3837
3838 Handles all actions necessary to clean up the scene when the mouse leaves
3839 the view.
3840*/
3841void QGraphicsScenePrivate::leaveScene(QWidget *viewport)
3842{
3843#if QT_CONFIG(tooltip)
3844 QToolTip::hideText();
3845#endif
3846 QGraphicsView *view = qobject_cast<QGraphicsView *>(object: viewport->parent());
3847 // Send HoverLeave events to all existing hover items, topmost first.
3848 QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent hoverEvent;
3849 hoverEvent.setWidget(viewport);
3850
3851 if (view) {
3852 QPoint cursorPos = QCursor::pos();
3853 hoverEvent.setScenePos(view->mapToScene(point: viewport->mapFromGlobal(cursorPos)));
3854 hoverEvent.setLastScenePos(hoverEvent.scenePos());
3855 hoverEvent.setScreenPos(cursorPos);
3856 hoverEvent.setLastScreenPos(hoverEvent.screenPos());
3857 }
3858
3859 while (!hoverItems.isEmpty()) {
3860 QGraphicsItem *lastItem = hoverItems.takeLast();
3861 if (itemAcceptsHoverEvents_helper(item: lastItem))
3862 sendHoverEvent(type: QEvent::GraphicsSceneHoverLeave, item: lastItem, hoverEvent: &hoverEvent);
3863 }
3864}
3865
3866/*!
3867 This event handler, for event \a keyEvent, can be reimplemented in a
3868 subclass to receive keypress events. The default implementation forwards
3869 the event to current focus item.
3870
3871 \sa QGraphicsItem::keyPressEvent(), focusItem()
3872*/
3873void QGraphicsScene::keyPressEvent(QKeyEvent *keyEvent)
3874{
3875 // ### Merge this function with keyReleaseEvent; they are identical
3876 // ### (except this comment).
3877 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
3878 QGraphicsItem *item = !d->keyboardGrabberItems.isEmpty() ? d->keyboardGrabberItems.constLast() : 0;
3879 if (!item)
3880 item = focusItem();
3881 if (item) {
3882 QGraphicsItem *p = item;
3883 do {
3884 // Accept the event by default
3885 keyEvent->accept();
3886 // Send it; QGraphicsItem::keyPressEvent ignores it. If the event
3887 // is filtered out, stop propagating it.
3888 if (p->isBlockedByModalPanel())
3889 break;
3890 if (!d->sendEvent(item: p, event: keyEvent))
3891 break;
3892 } while (!keyEvent->isAccepted() && !p->isPanel() && (p = p->parentItem()));
3893 } else {
3894 keyEvent->ignore();
3895 }
3896}
3897
3898/*!
3899 This event handler, for event \a keyEvent, can be reimplemented in a
3900 subclass to receive key release events. The default implementation
3901 forwards the event to current focus item.
3902
3903 \sa QGraphicsItem::keyReleaseEvent(), focusItem()
3904*/
3905void QGraphicsScene::keyReleaseEvent(QKeyEvent *keyEvent)
3906{
3907 // ### Merge this function with keyPressEvent; they are identical (except
3908 // ### this comment).
3909 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
3910 QGraphicsItem *item = !d->keyboardGrabberItems.isEmpty() ? d->keyboardGrabberItems.constLast() : 0;
3911 if (!item)
3912 item = focusItem();
3913 if (item) {
3914 QGraphicsItem *p = item;
3915 do {
3916 // Accept the event by default
3917 keyEvent->accept();
3918 // Send it; QGraphicsItem::keyPressEvent ignores it. If the event
3919 // is filtered out, stop propagating it.
3920 if (p->isBlockedByModalPanel())
3921 break;
3922 if (!d->sendEvent(item: p, event: keyEvent))
3923 break;
3924 } while (!keyEvent->isAccepted() && !p->isPanel() && (p = p->parentItem()));
3925 } else {
3926 keyEvent->ignore();
3927 }
3928}
3929
3930/*!
3931 This event handler, for event \a mouseEvent, can be reimplemented
3932 in a subclass to receive mouse press events for the scene.
3933
3934 The default implementation depends on the state of the scene. If
3935 there is a mouse grabber item, then the event is sent to the mouse
3936 grabber. Otherwise, it is forwarded to the topmost visible item that
3937 accepts mouse events at the scene position from the event, and
3938 that item promptly becomes the mouse grabber item.
3939
3940 If there is no item at the given position on the scene, the
3941 selection area is reset, any focus item loses its input focus, and
3942 the event is then ignored.
3943
3944 Note: See items() for a definition of which items are considered visible by this function.
3945
3946 \sa QGraphicsItem::mousePressEvent(),
3947 QGraphicsItem::setAcceptedMouseButtons()
3948*/
3949void QGraphicsScene::mousePressEvent(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *mouseEvent)
3950{
3951 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
3952 if (d->mouseGrabberItems.isEmpty()) {
3953 // Dispatch hover events
3954 QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent hover;
3955 _q_hoverFromMouseEvent(hover: &hover, mouseEvent);
3956 d->dispatchHoverEvent(hoverEvent: &hover);
3957 }
3958
3959 d->mousePressEventHandler(mouseEvent);
3960}
3961
3962/*!
3963 This event handler, for event \a mouseEvent, can be reimplemented
3964 in a subclass to receive mouse move events for the scene.
3965
3966 The default implementation depends on the mouse grabber state. If there is
3967 a mouse grabber item, the event is sent to the mouse grabber. If there
3968 are any items that accept hover events at the current position, the event
3969 is translated into a hover event and accepted; otherwise it's ignored.
3970
3971 \sa QGraphicsItem::mousePressEvent(), QGraphicsItem::mouseReleaseEvent(),
3972 QGraphicsItem::mouseDoubleClickEvent(), QGraphicsItem::setAcceptedMouseButtons()
3973*/
3974void QGraphicsScene::mouseMoveEvent(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *mouseEvent)
3975{
3976 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
3977 if (d->mouseGrabberItems.isEmpty()) {
3978 if (mouseEvent->buttons())
3979 return;
3980 QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent hover;
3981 _q_hoverFromMouseEvent(hover: &hover, mouseEvent);
3982 mouseEvent->setAccepted(d->dispatchHoverEvent(hoverEvent: &hover));
3983 return;
3984 }
3985
3986 // Forward the event to the mouse grabber
3987 d->sendMouseEvent(mouseEvent);
3988 mouseEvent->accept();
3989}
3990
3991/*!
3992 This event handler, for event \a mouseEvent, can be reimplemented
3993 in a subclass to receive mouse release events for the scene.
3994
3995 The default implementation depends on the mouse grabber state. If
3996 there is no mouse grabber, the event is ignored. Otherwise, if
3997 there is a mouse grabber item, the event is sent to the mouse
3998 grabber. If this mouse release represents the last pressed button
3999 on the mouse, the mouse grabber item then loses the mouse grab.
4000
4001 \sa QGraphicsItem::mousePressEvent(), QGraphicsItem::mouseMoveEvent(),
4002 QGraphicsItem::mouseDoubleClickEvent(), QGraphicsItem::setAcceptedMouseButtons()
4003*/
4004void QGraphicsScene::mouseReleaseEvent(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *mouseEvent)
4005{
4006 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
4007 if (d->mouseGrabberItems.isEmpty()) {
4008 mouseEvent->ignore();
4009 return;
4010 }
4011
4012 // Forward the event to the mouse grabber
4013 d->sendMouseEvent(mouseEvent);
4014 mouseEvent->accept();
4015
4016 // Reset the mouse grabber when the last mouse button has been released.
4017 if (!mouseEvent->buttons()) {
4018 if (!d->mouseGrabberItems.isEmpty()) {
4019 d->lastMouseGrabberItem = d->mouseGrabberItems.constLast();
4020 if (d->lastMouseGrabberItemHasImplicitMouseGrab)
4021 d->mouseGrabberItems.constLast()->ungrabMouse();
4022 } else {
4023 d->lastMouseGrabberItem = nullptr;
4024 }
4025
4026 // Generate a hoverevent
4027 QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent hoverEvent;
4028 _q_hoverFromMouseEvent(hover: &hoverEvent, mouseEvent);
4029 d->dispatchHoverEvent(hoverEvent: &hoverEvent);
4030 }
4031}
4032
4033/*!
4034 This event handler, for event \a mouseEvent, can be reimplemented
4035 in a subclass to receive mouse double-click events for the scene.
4036
4037 If someone doubleclicks on the scene, the scene will first receive
4038 a mouse press event, followed by a release event (i.e., a click),
4039 then a double-click event, and finally a release event. If the
4040 double-click event is delivered to a different item than the one
4041 that received the first press and release, it will be delivered as
4042 a press event. However, tripleclick events are not delivered as
4043 double-click events in this case.
4044
4045 The default implementation is similar to mousePressEvent().
4046
4047 Note: See items() for a definition of which items are considered visible by this function.
4048
4049 \sa QGraphicsItem::mousePressEvent(), QGraphicsItem::mouseMoveEvent(),
4050 QGraphicsItem::mouseReleaseEvent(), QGraphicsItem::setAcceptedMouseButtons()
4051*/
4052void QGraphicsScene::mouseDoubleClickEvent(QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *mouseEvent)
4053{
4054 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
4055 d->mousePressEventHandler(mouseEvent);
4056}
4057
4058/*!
4059 This event handler, for event \a wheelEvent, can be reimplemented in a
4060 subclass to receive mouse wheel events for the scene.
4061
4062 By default, the event is delivered to the topmost visible item under the
4063 cursor. If ignored, the event propagates to the item beneath, and again
4064 until the event is accepted, or it reaches the scene. If no items accept
4065 the event, it is ignored.
4066
4067 Note: See items() for a definition of which items are considered visible by this function.
4068
4069 \sa QGraphicsItem::wheelEvent()
4070*/
4071void QGraphicsScene::wheelEvent(QGraphicsSceneWheelEvent *wheelEvent)
4072{
4073 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
4074 const QList<QGraphicsItem *> wheelCandidates = d->itemsAtPosition(screenPos: wheelEvent->screenPos(),
4075 scenePos: wheelEvent->scenePos(),
4076 widget: wheelEvent->widget());
4077
4078 // Find the first popup under the mouse (including the popup's descendants) starting from the last.
4079 // Remove all popups after the one found, or all or them if no popup is under the mouse.
4080 // Then continue with the event.
4081 QList<QGraphicsWidget *>::const_iterator iter = d->popupWidgets.constEnd();
4082 while (iter > d->popupWidgets.constBegin() && !wheelCandidates.isEmpty()) {
4083 --iter;
4084 if (wheelCandidates.first() == *iter || (*iter)->isAncestorOf(child: wheelCandidates.first()))
4085 break;
4086 d->removePopup(widget: *iter);
4087 }
4088
4089 bool hasSetFocus = false;
4090 for (QGraphicsItem *item : wheelCandidates) {
4091 if (!hasSetFocus && item->isEnabled()
4092 && ((item->flags() & QGraphicsItem::ItemIsFocusable) && item->d_ptr->mouseSetsFocus)) {
4093 if (item->isWidget() && static_cast<QGraphicsWidget *>(item)->focusPolicy() == Qt::WheelFocus) {
4094 hasSetFocus = true;
4095 if (item != focusItem())
4096 setFocusItem(item, focusReason: Qt::MouseFocusReason);
4097 }
4098 }
4099
4100 wheelEvent->setPos(item->d_ptr->genericMapFromScene(pos: wheelEvent->scenePos(),
4101 viewport: wheelEvent->widget()));
4102 wheelEvent->accept();
4103 bool isPanel = item->isPanel();
4104 bool ret = d->sendEvent(item, event: wheelEvent);
4105
4106 if (ret && (isPanel || wheelEvent->isAccepted()))
4107 break;
4108 }
4109}

4111/*!
4112 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented in a
4113 subclass to receive input method events for the scene.
4114
4115 The default implementation forwards the event to the focusItem().
4116 If no item currently has focus or the current focus item does not
4117 accept input methods, this function does nothing.
4118
4119 \sa QGraphicsItem::inputMethodEvent()
4120*/
4121void QGraphicsScene::inputMethodEvent(QInputMethodEvent *event)
4122{
4123 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
4124 if (d->focusItem && (d->focusItem->flags() & QGraphicsItem::ItemAcceptsInputMethod)) {
4125 d->sendEvent(item: d->focusItem, event);
4126 return;
4127 }
4128 if (d->lastFocusItem && d->lastFocusItem != d->focusItem && (d->lastFocusItem->flags() & QGraphicsItem::ItemAcceptsInputMethod))
4129 d->sendEvent(item: d->lastFocusItem, event);
4130}
