4185
4186static void _q_paintItem(QGraphicsItem *item, QPainter *painter,
4187 const QStyleOptionGraphicsItem *option, QWidget *widget,
4188 bool useWindowOpacity, bool painterStateProtection)
4189{
4190 if (!item->isWidget()) {
4191 item->paint(painter, option, widget);
4192 return;
4193 }
4194 QGraphicsWidget *widgetItem = static_cast<QGraphicsWidget *>(item);
4195 QGraphicsProxyWidget *proxy = qobject_cast<QGraphicsProxyWidget *>(object: widgetItem);
4196 const qreal windowOpacity = (proxy && proxy->widget() && useWindowOpacity)
4197 ? proxy->widget()->windowOpacity() : 1.0;
4198 const qreal oldPainterOpacity = painter->opacity();
4199
4200 if (qFuzzyIsNull(d: windowOpacity))
4201 return;
4202 // Set new painter opacity.
4203 if (windowOpacity < 1.0)
4204 painter->setOpacity(oldPainterOpacity * windowOpacity);
4205
4206 // set layoutdirection on the painter
4207 Qt::LayoutDirection oldLayoutDirection = painter->layoutDirection();
4208 painter->setLayoutDirection(widgetItem->layoutDirection());
4209
4210 if (widgetItem->isWindow() && widgetItem->windowType() != Qt::Popup && widgetItem->windowType() != Qt::ToolTip
4211 && !(widgetItem->windowFlags() & Qt::FramelessWindowHint)) {
4212 if (painterStateProtection)
4213 painter->save();
4214 widgetItem->paintWindowFrame(painter, option, widget);
4215 if (painterStateProtection)
4216 painter->restore();
4217 } else if (widgetItem->autoFillBackground()) {
4218 painter->fillRect(option->exposedRect, widgetItem->palette().window());
4219 }
4220
4221 widgetItem->paint(painter, option, widget);
4222
4223 // Restore layoutdirection on the painter.
4224 painter->setLayoutDirection(oldLayoutDirection);
4225 // Restore painter opacity.
4226 if (windowOpacity < 1.0)
4227 painter->setOpacity(oldPainterOpacity);
4228}
4229
4230static void _q_paintIntoCache(QPixmap *pix, QGraphicsItem *item, const QRegion &pixmapExposed,
4231 const QTransform &itemToPixmap, QPainter::RenderHints renderHints,
4232 const QStyleOptionGraphicsItem *option, bool painterStateProtection)
4233{
4234 QPixmap subPix;
4235 QPainter pixmapPainter;
4236 QRect br = pixmapExposed.boundingRect();
4237
4238 // Don't use subpixmap if we get a full update.
4239 if (pixmapExposed.isEmpty() || (pixmapExposed.rectCount() == 1 && br.contains(r: pix->rect()))) {
4240 pix->fill(fillColor: Qt::transparent);
4241 pixmapPainter.begin(pix);
4242 } else {
4243 subPix = QPixmap(br.size() * pix->devicePixelRatio());
4244 subPix.setDevicePixelRatio(pix->devicePixelRatio());
4245 subPix.fill(fillColor: Qt::transparent);
4246 pixmapPainter.begin(&subPix);
4247 pixmapPainter.translate(offset: -br.topLeft());
4248 if (!pixmapExposed.isEmpty()) {
4249 // Applied to subPix; paint is adjusted to the coordinate space is
4250 // correct.
4251 pixmapPainter.setClipRegion(pixmapExposed);
4252 }
4253 }
4254
4255 pixmapPainter.setRenderHints(hints: pixmapPainter.renderHints(), on: false);
4256 pixmapPainter.setRenderHints(hints: renderHints, on: true);
4257 pixmapPainter.setWorldTransform(matrix: itemToPixmap, combine: true);
4258
4259 // Render.
4260 _q_paintItem(item, painter: &pixmapPainter, option, widget: nullptr, useWindowOpacity: false, painterStateProtection);
4261 pixmapPainter.end();
4262
4263 if (!subPix.isNull()) {
4264 // Blit the subpixmap into the main pixmap.
4265 pixmapPainter.begin(pix);
4266 pixmapPainter.setCompositionMode(QPainter::CompositionMode_Source);
4267 pixmapPainter.setClipRegion(pixmapExposed);
4268 pixmapPainter.drawPixmap(p: br.topLeft(), pm: subPix);
4269 pixmapPainter.end();
4270 }
4271}
4272
4273// Copied from qpaintengine_vg.cpp
4274// Returns \c true for 90, 180, and 270 degree rotations.
4275static inline bool transformIsSimple(const QTransform& transform)
4276{
4277 QTransform::TransformationType type = transform.type();
4278 if (type <= QTransform::TxScale) {
4279 return true;
4280 } else if (type == QTransform::TxRotate) {
4281 // Check for 90, and 270 degree rotations.
4282 qreal m11 = transform.m11();
4283 qreal m12 = transform.m12();
4284 qreal m21 = transform.m21();
4285 qreal m22 = transform.m22();
4286 if (m11 == 0.0f && m22 == 0.0f) {
4287 if (m12 == 1.0f && m21 == -1.0f)
4288 return true; // 90 degrees.
4289 else if (m12 == -1.0f && m21 == 1.0f)
4290 return true; // 270 degrees.
4291 else if (m12 == -1.0f && m21 == -1.0f)
4292 return true; // 90 degrees inverted y.
4293 else if (m12 == 1.0f && m21 == 1.0f)
4294 return true; // 270 degrees inverted y.
4295 }
4296 }
4297 return false;
4298}
4299
4300/*!
4301 \internal
4302
4303 Draws items directly, or using cache.
4304*/
4305void QGraphicsScenePrivate::drawItemHelper(QGraphicsItem *item, QPainter *painter,
4306 const QStyleOptionGraphicsItem *option, QWidget *widget,
4307 bool painterStateProtection)
4308{
4309 QGraphicsItemPrivate *itemd = item->d_ptr.data();
4310 QGraphicsItem::CacheMode cacheMode = QGraphicsItem::CacheMode(itemd->cacheMode);
4311
4312 // Render directly, using no cache.
4313 if (cacheMode == QGraphicsItem::NoCache) {
4314 _q_paintItem(item: static_cast<QGraphicsWidget *>(item), painter, option, widget, useWindowOpacity: true, painterStateProtection);
4315 return;
4316 }
4317
4318 const qreal devicePixelRatio = painter->device()->devicePixelRatio();
4319 const qreal oldPainterOpacity = painter->opacity();
4320 qreal newPainterOpacity = oldPainterOpacity;
4321 QGraphicsProxyWidget *proxy = item->isWidget() ? qobject_cast<QGraphicsProxyWidget *>(object: static_cast<QGraphicsWidget *>(item)) : 0;
4322 if (proxy && proxy->widget()) {
4323 const qreal windowOpacity = proxy->widget()->windowOpacity();
4324 if (windowOpacity < 1.0)
4325 newPainterOpacity *= windowOpacity;
4326 }
4327
4328 // Item's (local) bounding rect
4329 QRectF brect = item->boundingRect();
4330 QRectF adjustedBrect(brect);
4331 _q_adjustRect(rect: &adjustedBrect);
4332 if (adjustedBrect.isEmpty())
4333 return;
4334
4335 // Fetch the off-screen transparent buffer and exposed area info.
4336 QPixmapCache::Key pixmapKey;
4337 QPixmap pix;
4338
4339 bool pixmapFound;
4340 QGraphicsItemCache *itemCache = itemd->extraItemCache();
4341 if (cacheMode == QGraphicsItem::ItemCoordinateCache) {
4342 pixmapKey = itemCache->key;
4343 } else {
4344 pixmapKey = itemCache->deviceData.value(key: widget).key;
4345 }
4346
4347 // Find pixmap in cache.
4348 pixmapFound = QPixmapCache::find(key: pixmapKey, pixmap: &pix);
4349
4350 // Render using item coordinate cache mode.
4351 if (cacheMode == QGraphicsItem::ItemCoordinateCache) {
4352 QSize pixmapSize;
4353 bool fixedCacheSize = itemCache->fixedSize.isValid();
4354 QRect br = brect.toAlignedRect();
4355 if (fixedCacheSize) {
4356 pixmapSize = itemCache->fixedSize;
4357 } else {
4358 pixmapSize = br.size();
4359 }
4360
4361 pixmapSize *= devicePixelRatio;
4362
4363 // Create or recreate the pixmap.
4364 int adjust = itemCache->fixedSize.isValid() ? 0 : 2;
4365 QSize adjustSize(adjust*2, adjust*2);
4366 br.adjust(dx1: -adjust / devicePixelRatio, dy1: -adjust / devicePixelRatio, dx2: adjust / devicePixelRatio, dy2: adjust / devicePixelRatio);
4367 if (pix.isNull() || (!fixedCacheSize && (pixmapSize + adjustSize) != pix.size())) {
4368 pix = QPixmap(pixmapSize + adjustSize);
4369 itemCache->boundingRect = br;
4370 itemCache->exposed.clear();
4371 itemCache->allExposed = true;
4372 } else if (itemCache->boundingRect != br) {
4373 itemCache->boundingRect = br;
4374 itemCache->exposed.clear();
4375 itemCache->allExposed = true;
4376 }
4377
4378 // Redraw any newly exposed areas.
4379 if (itemCache->allExposed || !itemCache->exposed.isEmpty()) {
4380
4381 //We know that we will modify the pixmap, removing it from the cache
4382 //will detach the one we have and avoid a deep copy
4383 if (pixmapFound)
4384 QPixmapCache::remove(key: pixmapKey);
4385
4386 // Fit the item's bounding rect into the pixmap's coordinates.
4387 QTransform itemToPixmap;
4388 if (fixedCacheSize) {
4389 const QPointF scale((pixmapSize.width() / devicePixelRatio) / brect.width(),
4390 (pixmapSize.height() / devicePixelRatio) / brect.height());
4391 itemToPixmap.scale(sx: scale.x(), sy: scale.y());
4392 }
4393 itemToPixmap.translate(dx: -br.x(), dy: -br.y());
4394
4395 // Generate the item's exposedRect and map its list of expose
4396 // rects to device coordinates.
4397 styleOptionTmp = *option;
4398 QRegion pixmapExposed;
4399 QRectF exposedRect;
4400 if (!itemCache->allExposed) {
4401 for (const auto &rect : std::as_const(t&: itemCache->exposed)) {
4402 exposedRect |= rect;
4403 pixmapExposed += itemToPixmap.mapRect(rect).toAlignedRect();
4404 }
4405 } else {
4406 exposedRect = brect;
4407 }
4408 styleOptionTmp.exposedRect = exposedRect;
4409
4410 // Render.
4411 pix.setDevicePixelRatio(devicePixelRatio);
4412 _q_paintIntoCache(pix: &pix, item, pixmapExposed, itemToPixmap, renderHints: painter->renderHints(),
4413 option: &styleOptionTmp, painterStateProtection);
4414
4415 // insert this pixmap into the cache.
4416 itemCache->key = QPixmapCache::insert(pixmap: pix);
4417
4418 // Reset expose data.
4419 itemCache->allExposed = false;
4420 itemCache->exposed.clear();
4421 }
4422
4423 // Redraw the exposed area using the transformed painter. Depending on
4424 // the hardware, this may be a server-side operation, or an expensive
4425 // qpixmap-image-transform-pixmap roundtrip.
4426 if (newPainterOpacity != oldPainterOpacity) {
4427 painter->setOpacity(newPainterOpacity);
4428 painter->drawPixmap(p: br.topLeft(), pm: pix);
4429 painter->setOpacity(oldPainterOpacity);
4430 } else {
4431 painter->drawPixmap(p: br.topLeft(), pm: pix);
4432 }
4433 return;
4434 }
4435
4436 // Render using device coordinate cache mode.
4437 if (cacheMode == QGraphicsItem::DeviceCoordinateCache) {
4438 // Find the item's bounds in device coordinates.
4439 QRectF deviceBounds = painter->worldTransform().mapRect(brect);
4440 QRect deviceRect = deviceBounds.toRect().adjusted(xp1: -1, yp1: -1, xp2: 1, yp2: 1);
4441 if (deviceRect.isEmpty())
4442 return;
4443 QRect viewRect = widget ? widget->rect() : QRect();
4444 if (widget && !viewRect.intersects(r: deviceRect))
4445 return;
4446
4447 // Resort to direct rendering if the device rect exceeds the
4448 // (optional) maximum bounds. (QGraphicsSvgItem uses this).
4449 QSize maximumCacheSize =
4450 itemd->extra(type: QGraphicsItemPrivate::ExtraMaxDeviceCoordCacheSize).toSize();
4451 if (!maximumCacheSize.isEmpty()
4452 && (deviceRect.width() > maximumCacheSize.width()
4453 || deviceRect.height() > maximumCacheSize.height())) {
4454 _q_paintItem(item: static_cast<QGraphicsWidget *>(item), painter, option, widget,
4455 useWindowOpacity: oldPainterOpacity != newPainterOpacity, painterStateProtection);
4456 return;
4457 }
4458
4459 // Create or reuse offscreen pixmap, possibly scroll/blit from the old one.
4460 // If the world transform is rotated we always recreate the cache to avoid
4461 // wrong blending.
4462 bool pixModified = false;
4463 QGraphicsItemCache::DeviceData *deviceData = &itemCache->deviceData[widget];
4464 bool invertable = true;
4465 QTransform diff = deviceData->lastTransform.inverted(invertible: &invertable);
4466 if (invertable)
4467 diff *= painter->worldTransform();
4468 deviceData->lastTransform = painter->worldTransform();
4469 bool allowPartialCacheExposure = false;
4470 bool simpleTransform = invertable && diff.type() <= QTransform::TxTranslate
4471 && transformIsSimple(transform: painter->worldTransform());
4472 if (!simpleTransform) {
4473 pixModified = true;
4474 itemCache->allExposed = true;
4475 itemCache->exposed.clear();
4476 deviceData->cacheIndent = QPoint();
4477 pix = QPixmap();
4478 } else if (!viewRect.isNull()) {
4479 allowPartialCacheExposure = deviceData->cacheIndent != QPoint();
4480 }
4481
4482 // Allow partial cache exposure if the device rect isn't fully contained and
4483 // deviceRect is 20% taller or wider than the viewRect.
4484 if (!allowPartialCacheExposure && !viewRect.isNull() && !viewRect.contains(r: deviceRect)) {
4485 allowPartialCacheExposure = (viewRect.width() * 1.2 < deviceRect.width())
4486 || (viewRect.height() * 1.2 < deviceRect.height());
4487 }
4488
4489 QRegion scrollExposure;
4490 if (allowPartialCacheExposure) {
4491 // Part of pixmap is drawn. Either device contains viewrect (big
4492 // item covers whole screen) or parts of device are outside the
4493 // viewport. In either case the device rect must be the intersect
4494 // between the two.
4495 int dx = deviceRect.left() < viewRect.left() ? viewRect.left() - deviceRect.left() : 0;
4496 int dy = deviceRect.top() < viewRect.top() ? viewRect.top() - deviceRect.top() : 0;
4497 QPoint newCacheIndent(dx, dy);
4498 deviceRect &= viewRect;
4499
4500 if (pix.isNull()) {
4501 deviceData->cacheIndent = QPoint();
4502 itemCache->allExposed = true;
4503 itemCache->exposed.clear();
4504 pixModified = true;
4505 }
4506
4507 // Copy / "scroll" the old pixmap onto the new ole and calculate
4508 // scrolled exposure.
4509 if (newCacheIndent != deviceData->cacheIndent || deviceRect.size() != pix.size() / devicePixelRatio) {
4510 QPoint diff = newCacheIndent - deviceData->cacheIndent;
4511 QPixmap newPix(deviceRect.size() * devicePixelRatio);
4512 // ### Investigate removing this fill (test with Plasma and
4513 // graphicssystem raster).
4514 newPix.fill(fillColor: Qt::transparent);
4515 if (!pix.isNull()) {
4516 newPix.setDevicePixelRatio(devicePixelRatio);
4517 QPainter newPixPainter(&newPix);
4518 newPixPainter.drawPixmap(p: -diff, pm: pix);
4519 newPixPainter.end();
4520 }
4521 QRegion exposed;
4522 exposed += QRect(QPoint(0,0), newPix.size() / devicePixelRatio);
4523 if (!pix.isNull())
4524 exposed -= QRect(-diff, pix.size() / devicePixelRatio);
4525 scrollExposure = exposed;
4526
4527 pix = newPix;
4528 pixModified = true;
4529 }
4530 deviceData->cacheIndent = newCacheIndent;
4531 } else {
4532 // Full pixmap is drawn.
4533 deviceData->cacheIndent = QPoint();
4534
4535 // Auto-adjust the pixmap size.
4536 if (deviceRect.size() != pix.size() / devicePixelRatio) {
4537 // exposed needs to cover the whole pixmap
4538 pix = QPixmap(deviceRect.size() * devicePixelRatio);
4539 pixModified = true;
4540 itemCache->allExposed = true;
4541 itemCache->exposed.clear();
4542 }
4543 }
4544
4545 // Check for newly invalidated areas.
4546 if (itemCache->allExposed || !itemCache->exposed.isEmpty() || !scrollExposure.isEmpty()) {
4547 //We know that we will modify the pixmap, removing it from the cache
4548 //will detach the one we have and avoid a deep copy
4549 if (pixmapFound)
4550 QPixmapCache::remove(key: pixmapKey);
4551
4552 // Construct an item-to-pixmap transform.
4553 QPointF p = deviceRect.topLeft();
4554 QTransform itemToPixmap = painter->worldTransform();
4555 if (!p.isNull())
4556 itemToPixmap *= QTransform::fromTranslate(dx: -p.x(), dy: -p.y());
4557
4558 // Map the item's logical expose to pixmap coordinates.
4559 QRegion pixmapExposed = scrollExposure;
4560 if (!itemCache->allExposed) {
4561 for (const auto &rect : std::as_const(t&: itemCache->exposed))
4562 pixmapExposed += itemToPixmap.mapRect(rect).toRect().adjusted(xp1: -1, yp1: -1, xp2: 1, yp2: 1);
4563 }
4564
4565 // Calculate the style option's exposedRect.
4566 QRectF br;
4567 if (itemCache->allExposed) {
4568 br = item->boundingRect();
4569 } else {
4570 for (const auto &rect : std::as_const(t&: itemCache->exposed))
4571 br |= rect;
4572 QTransform pixmapToItem = itemToPixmap.inverted();
4573 for (const QRect &r : std::as_const(t&: scrollExposure))
4574 br |= pixmapToItem.mapRect(r);
4575 }
4576 styleOptionTmp = *option;
4577 styleOptionTmp.exposedRect = br.adjusted(xp1: -1, yp1: -1, xp2: 1, yp2: 1);
4578
4579 // Render the exposed areas.
4580 pix.setDevicePixelRatio(devicePixelRatio);
4581 _q_paintIntoCache(pix: &pix, item, pixmapExposed, itemToPixmap, renderHints: painter->renderHints(),
4582 option: &styleOptionTmp, painterStateProtection);
4583
4584 // Reset expose data.
4585 pixModified = true;
4586 itemCache->allExposed = false;
4587 itemCache->exposed.clear();
4588 }
4589
4590 if (pixModified) {
4591 // Insert this pixmap into the cache.
4592 deviceData->key = QPixmapCache::insert(pixmap: pix);
4593 }
4594
4595 // Redraw the exposed area using an untransformed painter. This
4596 // effectively becomes a bitblit that does not transform the cache.
4597 QTransform restoreTransform = painter->worldTransform();
4598 painter->setWorldTransform(matrix: QTransform());
4599 if (newPainterOpacity != oldPainterOpacity) {
4600 painter->setOpacity(newPainterOpacity);
4601 painter->drawPixmap(p: deviceRect.topLeft(), pm: pix);
4602 painter->setOpacity(oldPainterOpacity);
4603 } else {
4604 painter->drawPixmap(p: deviceRect.topLeft(), pm: pix);
4605 }
4606 painter->setWorldTransform(matrix: restoreTransform);
4607 return;
4608 }
4609}
4610
4611void QGraphicsScenePrivate::drawItems(QPainter *painter, const QTransform *const viewTransform,
4612 QRegion *exposedRegion, QWidget *widget)
4613{
4614 // Make sure we don't have unpolished items before we draw.
4615 if (!unpolishedItems.isEmpty())
4616 _q_polishItems();
4617
4618 updateAll = false;
4619 QRectF exposedSceneRect;
4620 if (exposedRegion && indexMethod != QGraphicsScene::NoIndex) {
4621 exposedSceneRect = exposedRegion->boundingRect().adjusted(xp1: -1, yp1: -1, xp2: 1, yp2: 1);
4622 if (viewTransform)
4623 exposedSceneRect = viewTransform->inverted().mapRect(exposedSceneRect);
4624 }
4625 const QList<QGraphicsItem *> tli = index->estimateTopLevelItems(exposedSceneRect, order: Qt::AscendingOrder);
4626 for (const auto subTree : tli)
4627 drawSubtreeRecursive(item: subTree, painter, viewTransform, exposedRegion, widget);
4628}
4629
4630void QGraphicsScenePrivate::drawSubtreeRecursive(QGraphicsItem *item, QPainter *painter,
4631 const QTransform *const viewTransform,
4632 QRegion *exposedRegion, QWidget *widget,
4633 qreal parentOpacity, const QTransform *const effectTransform)
4634{
4635 Q_ASSERT(item);
4636
4637 if (!item->d_ptr->visible)
4638 return;
4639
4640 const bool itemHasContents = !(item->d_ptr->flags & QGraphicsItem::ItemHasNoContents);
4641 const bool itemHasChildren = !item->d_ptr->children.isEmpty();
4642 if (!itemHasContents && !itemHasChildren)
4643 return; // Item has neither contents nor children!(?)
4644
4645 const qreal opacity = item->d_ptr->combineOpacityFromParent(parentOpacity);
4646 const bool itemIsFullyTransparent = QGraphicsItemPrivate::isOpacityNull(opacity);
4647 if (itemIsFullyTransparent && (!itemHasChildren || item->d_ptr->childrenCombineOpacity()))
4648 return;
4649
4650 QTransform transform(Qt::Uninitialized);
4651 QTransform *transformPtr = nullptr;
4652 bool translateOnlyTransform = false;
4653#define ENSURE_TRANSFORM_PTR \
4654 if (!transformPtr) { \
4655 Q_ASSERT(!itemIsUntransformable); \
4656 if (viewTransform) { \
4657 transform = item->d_ptr->sceneTransform; \
4658 transform *= *viewTransform; \
4659 transformPtr = &transform; \
4660 } else { \
4661 transformPtr = &item->d_ptr->sceneTransform; \
4662 translateOnlyTransform = item->d_ptr->sceneTransformTranslateOnly; \
4663 } \
4664 }
4665
4666 // Update the item's scene transform if the item is transformable;
4667 // otherwise calculate the full transform,
4668 bool wasDirtyParentSceneTransform = false;
4669 const bool itemIsUntransformable = item->d_ptr->itemIsUntransformable();
4670 if (itemIsUntransformable) {
4671 transform = item->deviceTransform(viewportTransform: viewTransform ? *viewTransform : QTransform());
4672 transformPtr = &transform;
4673 } else if (item->d_ptr->dirtySceneTransform) {
4674 item->d_ptr->updateSceneTransformFromParent();
4675 Q_ASSERT(!item->d_ptr->dirtySceneTransform);
4676 wasDirtyParentSceneTransform = true;
4677 }
4678
4679 const bool itemClipsChildrenToShape = (item->d_ptr->flags & QGraphicsItem::ItemClipsChildrenToShape
4680 || item->d_ptr->flags & QGraphicsItem::ItemContainsChildrenInShape);
4681 bool drawItem = itemHasContents && !itemIsFullyTransparent;
4682 if (drawItem || minimumRenderSize > 0.0) {
4683 const QRectF brect = adjustedItemEffectiveBoundingRect(item);
4684 ENSURE_TRANSFORM_PTR
4685 QRectF preciseViewBoundingRect = translateOnlyTransform ? brect.translated(dx: transformPtr->dx(), dy: transformPtr->dy())
4686 : transformPtr->mapRect(brect);
4687
4688 bool itemIsTooSmallToRender = false;
4689 if (minimumRenderSize > 0.0
4690 && (preciseViewBoundingRect.width() < minimumRenderSize
4691 || preciseViewBoundingRect.height() < minimumRenderSize)) {
4692 itemIsTooSmallToRender = true;
4693 drawItem = false;
4694 }
4695
4696 bool itemIsOutsideVisibleRect = false;
4697 if (drawItem) {
4698 QRect viewBoundingRect = preciseViewBoundingRect.toAlignedRect();
4699 viewBoundingRect.adjust(dx1: -int(rectAdjust), dy1: -int(rectAdjust), dx2: rectAdjust, dy2: rectAdjust);
4700 if (widget)
4701 item->d_ptr->paintedViewBoundingRects.insert(key: widget, value: viewBoundingRect);
4702 drawItem = exposedRegion ? exposedRegion->intersects(r: viewBoundingRect)
4703 : !viewBoundingRect.normalized().isEmpty();
4704 itemIsOutsideVisibleRect = !drawItem;
4705 }
4706
4707 if (itemIsTooSmallToRender || itemIsOutsideVisibleRect) {
4708 // We cannot simply use !drawItem here. If we did it is possible
4709 // to enter the outer if statement with drawItem == false and minimumRenderSize > 0
4710 // and finally end up inside this inner if, even though none of the above two
4711 // conditions are met. In that case we should not return from this function
4712 // but call draw() instead.
4713 if (!itemHasChildren)
4714 return;
4715 if (itemClipsChildrenToShape) {
4716 if (wasDirtyParentSceneTransform)
4717 item->d_ptr->invalidateChildrenSceneTransform();
4718 return;
4719 }
4720 }
4721 } // else we know for sure this item has children we must process.
4722
4723 if (itemHasChildren && itemClipsChildrenToShape)
4724 ENSURE_TRANSFORM_PTR;
4725
4726#if QT_CONFIG(graphicseffect)
4727 if (item->d_ptr->graphicsEffect && item->d_ptr->graphicsEffect->isEnabled()) {
4728 ENSURE_TRANSFORM_PTR;
4729 QGraphicsItemPaintInfo info(viewTransform, transformPtr, effectTransform, exposedRegion, widget, &styleOptionTmp,
4730 painter, opacity, wasDirtyParentSceneTransform, itemHasContents && !itemIsFullyTransparent);
4731 QGraphicsEffectSource *source = item->d_ptr->graphicsEffect->d_func()->source;
4732 QGraphicsItemEffectSourcePrivate *sourced = static_cast<QGraphicsItemEffectSourcePrivate *>
4733 (source->d_func());
4734 sourced->info = &info;
4735 const QTransform restoreTransform = painter->worldTransform();
4736 if (effectTransform)
4737 painter->setWorldTransform(matrix: *transformPtr * *effectTransform);
4738 else
4739 painter->setWorldTransform(matrix: *transformPtr);
4740 painter->setOpacity(opacity);
4741
4742 if (sourced->currentCachedSystem() != Qt::LogicalCoordinates
4743 && sourced->lastEffectTransform != painter->worldTransform())
4744 {
4745 if (sourced->lastEffectTransform.type() <= QTransform::TxTranslate
4746 && painter->worldTransform().type() <= QTransform::TxTranslate)
4747 {
4748 QRectF sourceRect = sourced->boundingRect(system: Qt::DeviceCoordinates);
4749 QRect effectRect = sourced->paddedEffectRect(system: Qt::DeviceCoordinates, mode: sourced->currentCachedMode(), sourceRect).toAlignedRect();
4750
4751 sourced->setCachedOffset(effectRect.topLeft());
4752 } else {
4753 sourced->invalidateCache(reason: QGraphicsEffectSourcePrivate::TransformChanged);
4754 }
4755
4756 sourced->lastEffectTransform = painter->worldTransform();
4757 }
4758
4759 item->d_ptr->graphicsEffect->draw(painter);
4760 painter->setWorldTransform(matrix: restoreTransform);
4761 sourced->info = nullptr;
4762 } else
4763#endif // QT_CONFIG(graphicseffect)
4764 {
4765 draw(item, painter, viewTransform, transformPtr, exposedRegion, widget, opacity,
4766 effectTransform, wasDirtyParentSceneTransform, drawItem);
4767 }
4768}
4769
4770static inline void setClip(QPainter *painter, QGraphicsItem *item)
4771{
4772 painter->save();
4773 QRectF clipRect;
4774 const QPainterPath clipPath(item->shape());
4775 if (QPathClipper::pathToRect(path: clipPath, rect: &clipRect))
4776 painter->setClipRect(clipRect, op: Qt::IntersectClip);
4777 else
4778 painter->setClipPath(path: clipPath, op: Qt::IntersectClip);
4779}
4780
4781static inline void setWorldTransform(QPainter *painter, const QTransform *const transformPtr,
4782 const QTransform *effectTransform)
4783{
4784 Q_ASSERT(transformPtr);
4785 if (effectTransform)
4786 painter->setWorldTransform(matrix: *transformPtr * *effectTransform);
4787 else
4788 painter->setWorldTransform(matrix: *transformPtr);
4789}
4790
4791void QGraphicsScenePrivate::draw(QGraphicsItem *item, QPainter *painter, const QTransform *const viewTransform,
4792 const QTransform *const transformPtr, QRegion *exposedRegion, QWidget *widget,
4793 qreal opacity, const QTransform *effectTransform,
4794 bool wasDirtyParentSceneTransform, bool drawItem)
4795{
4796 const auto &children = item->d_ptr->children;
4797
4798 const bool itemIsFullyTransparent = QGraphicsItemPrivate::isOpacityNull(opacity);
4799 const bool itemClipsChildrenToShape = (item->d_ptr->flags & QGraphicsItem::ItemClipsChildrenToShape);
4800 const bool itemHasChildren = !children.isEmpty();
4801 bool setChildClip = itemClipsChildrenToShape;
4802 bool itemHasChildrenStackedBehind = false;
4803
4804 int i = 0;
4805 if (itemHasChildren) {
4806 if (itemClipsChildrenToShape)
4807 setWorldTransform(painter, transformPtr, effectTransform);
4808
4809 item->d_ptr->ensureSortedChildren();
4810 // Items with the 'ItemStacksBehindParent' flag are put in front of the list
4811 // so all we have to do is to check the first item.
4812 itemHasChildrenStackedBehind = (children.at(i: 0)->d_ptr->flags
4813 & QGraphicsItem::ItemStacksBehindParent);
4814
4815 if (itemHasChildrenStackedBehind) {
4816 if (itemClipsChildrenToShape) {
4817 setClip(painter, item);
4818 setChildClip = false;
4819 }
4820
4821 // Draw children behind
4822 for (i = 0; i < children.size(); ++i) {
4823 QGraphicsItem *child = children.at(i);
4824 if (wasDirtyParentSceneTransform)
4825 child->d_ptr->dirtySceneTransform = 1;
4826 if (!(child->d_ptr->flags & QGraphicsItem::ItemStacksBehindParent))
4827 break;
4828 if (itemIsFullyTransparent && !(child->d_ptr->flags & QGraphicsItem::ItemIgnoresParentOpacity))
4829 continue;
4830 drawSubtreeRecursive(item: child, painter, viewTransform, exposedRegion, widget, parentOpacity: opacity, effectTransform);
4831 }
4832 }
4833 }
4834
4835 // Draw item
4836 if (drawItem) {
4837 Q_ASSERT(!itemIsFullyTransparent);
4838 Q_ASSERT(!(item->d_ptr->flags & QGraphicsItem::ItemHasNoContents));
4839 Q_ASSERT(transformPtr);
4840 item->d_ptr->initStyleOption(option: &styleOptionTmp, worldTransform: *transformPtr, exposedRegion: exposedRegion
4841 ? *exposedRegion : QRegion(), allItems: exposedRegion == nullptr);
4842
4843 const bool itemClipsToShape = item->d_ptr->flags & QGraphicsItem::ItemClipsToShape;
4844 bool restorePainterClip = false;
4845
4846 if (!itemHasChildren || !itemClipsChildrenToShape) {
4847 // Item does not have children or clip children to shape.
4848 setWorldTransform(painter, transformPtr, effectTransform);
4849 if ((restorePainterClip = itemClipsToShape))
4850 setClip(painter, item);
4851 } else if (itemHasChildrenStackedBehind){
4852 // Item clips children to shape and has children stacked behind, which means
4853 // the painter is already clipped to the item's shape.
4854 if (itemClipsToShape) {
4855 // The clip is already correct. Ensure correct world transform.
4856 setWorldTransform(painter, transformPtr, effectTransform);
4857 } else {
4858 // Remove clip (this also ensures correct world transform).
4859 painter->restore();
4860 setChildClip = true;
4861 }
4862 } else if (itemClipsToShape) {
4863 // Item clips children and itself to shape. It does not have hildren stacked
4864 // behind, which means the clip has not yet been set. We set it now and re-use it
4865 // for the children.
4866 setClip(painter, item);
4867 setChildClip = false;
4868 }
4869
4870 if (painterStateProtection && !restorePainterClip)
4871 painter->save();
4872
4873 painter->setOpacity(opacity);
4874 if (!item->d_ptr->cacheMode && !item->d_ptr->isWidget)
4875 item->paint(painter, option: &styleOptionTmp, widget);
4876 else
4877 drawItemHelper(item, painter, option: &styleOptionTmp, widget, painterStateProtection);
4878
4879 if (painterStateProtection || restorePainterClip)
4880 painter->restore();
4881
4882 static int drawRect = qEnvironmentVariableIntValue(varName: "QT_DRAW_SCENE_ITEM_RECTS");
4883 if (drawRect) {
4884 QPen oldPen = painter->pen();
4885 QBrush oldBrush = painter->brush();
4886 quintptr ptr = reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(item);
4887 const QColor color = QColor::fromHsv(h: ptr % 255, s: 255, v: 255);
4888 painter->setPen(color);
4889 painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
4890 painter->drawRect(rect: adjustedItemBoundingRect(item));
4891 painter->setPen(oldPen);
4892 painter->setBrush(oldBrush);
4893 }
4894 }
4895
4896 // Draw children in front
4897 if (itemHasChildren) {
4898 if (setChildClip)
4899 setClip(painter, item);
4900
4901 for (; i < children.size(); ++i) {
4902 QGraphicsItem *child = children.at(i);
4903 if (wasDirtyParentSceneTransform)
4904 child->d_ptr->dirtySceneTransform = 1;
4905 if (itemIsFullyTransparent && !(child->d_ptr->flags & QGraphicsItem::ItemIgnoresParentOpacity))
4906 continue;
4907 drawSubtreeRecursive(item: child, painter, viewTransform, exposedRegion, widget, parentOpacity: opacity, effectTransform);
4908 }
4909
4910 // Restore child clip
4911 if (itemClipsChildrenToShape)
4912 painter->restore();
4913 }
4914}
4915
4916void QGraphicsScenePrivate::markDirty(QGraphicsItem *item, const QRectF &rect, bool invalidateChildren,
4917 bool force, bool ignoreOpacity, bool removingItemFromScene,
4918 bool updateBoundingRect)
4919{
4920 Q_ASSERT(item);
4921 if (updateAll)
4922 return;
4923
4924 if (removingItemFromScene && !ignoreOpacity && !item->d_ptr->ignoreOpacity) {
4925 // If any of the item's ancestors ignore opacity, it means that the opacity
4926 // was set to 0 (and the update request has not yet been processed). That
4927 // also means that we have to ignore the opacity for the item itself; otherwise
4928 // things like: parent->setOpacity(0); scene->removeItem(child) won't work.
4929 // Note that we only do this when removing items from the scene. In all other
4930 // cases the ignoreOpacity bit propagates properly in processDirtyItems, but
4931 // since the item is removed immediately it won't be processed there.
4932 QGraphicsItem *p = item->d_ptr->parent;
4933 while (p) {
4934 if (p->d_ptr->ignoreOpacity) {
4935 item->d_ptr->ignoreOpacity = true;
4936 break;
4937 }
4938 p = p->d_ptr->parent;
4939 }
4940 }
4941
4942 if (item->d_ptr->discardUpdateRequest(/*ignoreVisibleBit=*/force,
4943 /*ignoreDirtyBit=*/removingItemFromScene || invalidateChildren,
4944 /*ignoreOpacity=*/ignoreOpacity)) {
4945 if (item->d_ptr->dirty) {
4946 // The item is already marked as dirty and will be processed later. However,
4947 // we have to make sure ignoreVisible and ignoreOpacity are set properly;
4948 // otherwise things like: item->update(); item->hide() (force is now true)
4949 // won't work as expected.
4950 if (force)
4951 item->d_ptr->ignoreVisible = 1;
4952 if (ignoreOpacity)
4953 item->d_ptr->ignoreOpacity = 1;
4954 }
4955 return;
4956 }
4957
4958 const bool fullItemUpdate = rect.isNull();
4959 if (!fullItemUpdate && rect.isEmpty())
4960 return;
4961
4962 if (!processDirtyItemsEmitted) {
4963 QMetaMethod method = q_ptr->metaObject()->method(index: processDirtyItemsIndex);
4964 method.invoke(obj: q_ptr, c: Qt::QueuedConnection);
4965// QMetaObject::invokeMethod(q_ptr, "_q_processDirtyItems", Qt::QueuedConnection);
4966 processDirtyItemsEmitted = true;
4967 }
4968
4969 if (removingItemFromScene) {
4970 // Note that this function can be called from the item's destructor, so
4971 // do NOT call any virtual functions on it within this block.
4972 if (isSignalConnected(signalIdx: changedSignalIndex) || views.isEmpty()) {
4973 // This block of code is kept for compatibility. Since 4.5, by default
4974 // QGraphicsView does not connect the signal and we use the below
4975 // method of delivering updates.
4976 q_func()->update();
4977 return;
4978 }
4979
4980 for (auto view : std::as_const(t&: views)) {
4981 QGraphicsViewPrivate *viewPrivate = view->d_func();
4982 QRect rect = item->d_ptr->paintedViewBoundingRects.value(key: viewPrivate->viewport);
4983 rect.translate(p: viewPrivate->dirtyScrollOffset);
4984 viewPrivate->updateRect(rect);
4985 }
4986 return;
4987 }
4988
4989 bool hasNoContents = item->d_ptr->flags & QGraphicsItem::ItemHasNoContents;
4990 if (!hasNoContents) {
4991 item->d_ptr->dirty = 1;
4992 if (fullItemUpdate)
4993 item->d_ptr->fullUpdatePending = 1;
4994 else if (!item->d_ptr->fullUpdatePending)
4995 item->d_ptr->needsRepaint |= rect;
4996 } else if (item->d_ptr->graphicsEffect) {
4997 invalidateChildren = true;
4998 }
4999
5000 if (invalidateChildren) {
5001 item->d_ptr->allChildrenDirty = 1;
5002 item->d_ptr->dirtyChildren = 1;
5003 }
5004
5005 if (force)
5006 item->d_ptr->ignoreVisible = 1;
5007 if (ignoreOpacity)
5008 item->d_ptr->ignoreOpacity = 1;
5009
5010 if (!updateBoundingRect)
5011 item->d_ptr->markParentDirty();
5012}
5013
5014static inline bool updateHelper(QGraphicsViewPrivate *view, QGraphicsItemPrivate *item,
5015 const QRectF &rect, bool itemIsUntransformable)
5016{
5017 Q_ASSERT(view);
5018 Q_ASSERT(item);
5019
5020 QGraphicsItem *itemq = static_cast<QGraphicsItem *>(item->q_ptr);
5021 QGraphicsView *viewq = static_cast<QGraphicsView *>(view->q_ptr);
5022
5023 if (itemIsUntransformable) {
5024 const QTransform xform = itemq->deviceTransform(viewportTransform: viewq->viewportTransform());
5025 if (!item->hasBoundingRegionGranularity)
5026 return view->updateRectF(rect: xform.mapRect(rect));
5027 return view->updateRegion(rect, xform);
5028 }
5029
5030 if (item->sceneTransformTranslateOnly && view->identityMatrix) {
5031 const qreal dx = item->sceneTransform.dx();
5032 const qreal dy = item->sceneTransform.dy();
5033 QRectF r(rect);
5034 r.translate(dx: dx - view->horizontalScroll(), dy: dy - view->verticalScroll());
5035 return view->updateRectF(rect: r);
5036 }
5037
5038 if (!viewq->isTransformed()) {
5039 if (!item->hasBoundingRegionGranularity)
5040 return view->updateRectF(rect: item->sceneTransform.mapRect(rect));
5041 return view->updateRegion(rect, xform: item->sceneTransform);
5042 }
5043
5044 QTransform xform = item->sceneTransform;
5045 xform *= viewq->viewportTransform();
5046 if (!item->hasBoundingRegionGranularity)
5047 return view->updateRectF(rect: xform.mapRect(rect));
5048 return view->updateRegion(rect, xform);
5049}
5050
5051void QGraphicsScenePrivate::processDirtyItemsRecursive(QGraphicsItem *item, bool dirtyAncestorContainsChildren,
5052 qreal parentOpacity)
5053{
5054 Q_Q(QGraphicsScene);
5055 Q_ASSERT(item);
5056 Q_ASSERT(!updateAll);
5057
5058 if (!item->d_ptr->dirty && !item->d_ptr->dirtyChildren) {
5059 resetDirtyItem(item);
5060 return;
5061 }
5062
5063 const bool itemIsHidden = !item->d_ptr->ignoreVisible && !item->d_ptr->visible;
5064 if (itemIsHidden) {
5065 resetDirtyItem(item, /*recursive=*/true);
5066 return;
5067 }
5068
5069 bool itemHasContents = !(item->d_ptr->flags & QGraphicsItem::ItemHasNoContents);
5070 const bool itemHasChildren = !item->d_ptr->children.isEmpty();
5071 if (!itemHasContents) {
5072 if (!itemHasChildren) {
5073 resetDirtyItem(item);
5074 return; // Item has neither contents nor children!(?)
5075 }
5076 if (item->d_ptr->graphicsEffect)
5077 itemHasContents = true;
5078 }
5079
5080 const qreal opacity = item->d_ptr->combineOpacityFromParent(parentOpacity);
5081 const bool itemIsFullyTransparent = !item->d_ptr->ignoreOpacity
5082 && QGraphicsItemPrivate::isOpacityNull(opacity);
5083 if (itemIsFullyTransparent && (!itemHasChildren || item->d_ptr->childrenCombineOpacity())) {
5084 resetDirtyItem(item, /*recursive=*/itemHasChildren);
5085 return;
5086 }
5087
5088 bool wasDirtyParentSceneTransform = item->d_ptr->dirtySceneTransform;
5089 const bool itemIsUntransformable = item->d_ptr->itemIsUntransformable();
5090 if (wasDirtyParentSceneTransform && !itemIsUntransformable) {
5091 item->d_ptr->updateSceneTransformFromParent();
5092 Q_ASSERT(!item->d_ptr->dirtySceneTransform);
5093 }
5094
5095 const bool wasDirtyParentViewBoundingRects = item->d_ptr->paintedViewBoundingRectsNeedRepaint;
5096 if (itemIsFullyTransparent || !itemHasContents || dirtyAncestorContainsChildren) {
5097 // Make sure we don't process invisible items or items with no content.
5098 item->d_ptr->dirty = 0;
5099 item->d_ptr->fullUpdatePending = 0;
5100 // Might have a dirty view bounding rect otherwise.
5101 if (itemIsFullyTransparent || !itemHasContents)
5102 item->d_ptr->paintedViewBoundingRectsNeedRepaint = 0;
5103 }
5104
5105 if (!hasSceneRect && item->d_ptr->geometryChanged && item->d_ptr->visible) {
5106 // Update growingItemsBoundingRect.
5107 if (item->d_ptr->sceneTransformTranslateOnly) {
5108 growingItemsBoundingRect |= item->boundingRect().translated(dx: item->d_ptr->sceneTransform.dx(),
5109 dy: item->d_ptr->sceneTransform.dy());
5110 } else {
5111 growingItemsBoundingRect |= item->d_ptr->sceneTransform.mapRect(item->boundingRect());
5112 }
5113 }
5114
5115 // Process item.
5116 if (item->d_ptr->dirty || item->d_ptr->paintedViewBoundingRectsNeedRepaint) {
5117 const bool useCompatUpdate = views.isEmpty() || isSignalConnected(signalIdx: changedSignalIndex);
5118 const QRectF itemBoundingRect = adjustedItemEffectiveBoundingRect(item);
5119
5120 if (useCompatUpdate && !itemIsUntransformable && qFuzzyIsNull(d: item->boundingRegionGranularity())) {
5121 // This block of code is kept for compatibility. Since 4.5, by default
5122 // QGraphicsView does not connect the signal and we use the below
5123 // method of delivering updates.
5124 if (item->d_ptr->sceneTransformTranslateOnly) {
5125 q->update(rect: itemBoundingRect.translated(dx: item->d_ptr->sceneTransform.dx(),
5126 dy: item->d_ptr->sceneTransform.dy()));
5127 } else {
5128 QRectF rect = item->d_ptr->sceneTransform.mapRect(itemBoundingRect);
5129 if (!rect.isEmpty())
5130 q->update(rect);
5131 }
5132 } else {
5133 QRectF dirtyRect;
5134 bool uninitializedDirtyRect = true;
5135
5136 for (auto view : std::as_const(t&: views)) {
5137 QGraphicsViewPrivate *viewPrivate = view->d_func();
5138 QRect &paintedViewBoundingRect = item->d_ptr->paintedViewBoundingRects[viewPrivate->viewport];
5139 if (viewPrivate->fullUpdatePending
5140 || viewPrivate->viewportUpdateMode == QGraphicsView::NoViewportUpdate) {
5141 // Okay, if we have a full update pending or no viewport update, this item's
5142 // paintedViewBoundingRect will be updated correctly in the next paintEvent if
5143 // it is inside the viewport, but for now we can pretend that it is outside.
5144 paintedViewBoundingRect = QRect(-1, -1, -1, -1);
5145 continue;
5146 }
5147
5148 if (item->d_ptr->paintedViewBoundingRectsNeedRepaint) {
5149 paintedViewBoundingRect.translate(p: viewPrivate->dirtyScrollOffset);
5150 if (!viewPrivate->updateRect(rect: paintedViewBoundingRect))
5151 paintedViewBoundingRect = QRect(-1, -1, -1, -1); // Outside viewport.
5152 }
5153
5154 if (!item->d_ptr->dirty)
5155 continue;
5156
5157 if (!item->d_ptr->paintedViewBoundingRectsNeedRepaint
5158 && paintedViewBoundingRect.x() == -1 && paintedViewBoundingRect.y() == -1
5159 && paintedViewBoundingRect.width() == -1 && paintedViewBoundingRect.height() == -1) {
5160 continue; // Outside viewport.
5161 }
5162
5163 if (uninitializedDirtyRect) {
5164 dirtyRect = itemBoundingRect;
5165 if (!item->d_ptr->fullUpdatePending) {
5166 _q_adjustRect(rect: &item->d_ptr->needsRepaint);
5167 dirtyRect &= item->d_ptr->needsRepaint;
5168 }
5169 uninitializedDirtyRect = false;
5170 }
5171
5172 if (dirtyRect.isEmpty())
5173 continue; // Discard updates outside the bounding rect.
5174
5175 if (!updateHelper(view: viewPrivate, item: item->d_ptr.data(), rect: dirtyRect, itemIsUntransformable)
5176 && item->d_ptr->paintedViewBoundingRectsNeedRepaint) {
5177 paintedViewBoundingRect = QRect(-1, -1, -1, -1); // Outside viewport.
5178 }
5179 }
5180 }
5181 }
5182
5183 // Process children.
5184 if (itemHasChildren && item->d_ptr->dirtyChildren) {
5185 const bool itemClipsChildrenToShape = item->d_ptr->flags & QGraphicsItem::ItemClipsChildrenToShape
5186 || item->d_ptr->flags & QGraphicsItem::ItemContainsChildrenInShape;
5187 // Items with no content are threated as 'dummy' items which means they are never drawn and
5188 // 'processed', so the painted view bounding rect is never up-to-date. This means that whenever
5189 // such an item changes geometry, its children have to take care of the update regardless
5190 // of whether the item clips children to shape or not.
5191 const bool bypassUpdateClip = !itemHasContents && wasDirtyParentViewBoundingRects;
5192 if (itemClipsChildrenToShape && !bypassUpdateClip) {
5193 // Make sure child updates are clipped to the item's bounding rect.
5194 for (auto view : std::as_const(t&: views))
5195 view->d_func()->setUpdateClip(item);
5196 }
5197 if (!dirtyAncestorContainsChildren) {
5198 dirtyAncestorContainsChildren = item->d_ptr->fullUpdatePending
5199 && itemClipsChildrenToShape;
5200 }
5201 const bool allChildrenDirty = item->d_ptr->allChildrenDirty;
5202 const bool parentIgnoresVisible = item->d_ptr->ignoreVisible;
5203 const bool parentIgnoresOpacity = item->d_ptr->ignoreOpacity;
5204 for (auto child : std::as_const(t&: item->d_ptr->children)) {
5205 if (wasDirtyParentSceneTransform)
5206 child->d_ptr->dirtySceneTransform = 1;
5207 if (wasDirtyParentViewBoundingRects)
5208 child->d_ptr->paintedViewBoundingRectsNeedRepaint = 1;
5209 if (parentIgnoresVisible)
5210 child->d_ptr->ignoreVisible = 1;
5211 if (parentIgnoresOpacity)
5212 child->d_ptr->ignoreOpacity = 1;
5213 if (allChildrenDirty) {
5214 child->d_ptr->dirty = 1;
5215 child->d_ptr->fullUpdatePending = 1;
5216 child->d_ptr->dirtyChildren = 1;
5217 child->d_ptr->allChildrenDirty = 1;
5218 }
5219 processDirtyItemsRecursive(item: child, dirtyAncestorContainsChildren, parentOpacity: opacity);
5220 }
5221
5222 if (itemClipsChildrenToShape) {
5223 // Reset updateClip.
5224 for (auto view : std::as_const(t&: views))
5225 view->d_func()->setUpdateClip(nullptr);
5226 }
5227 } else if (wasDirtyParentSceneTransform) {
5228 item->d_ptr->invalidateChildrenSceneTransform();
5229 }
5230
5231 resetDirtyItem(item);
5232}
5233
5234/*!
5235 \deprecated
5236
5237 Paints the given \a items using the provided \a painter, after the
5238 background has been drawn, and before the foreground has been
5239 drawn. All painting is done in \e scene coordinates. Before
5240 drawing each item, the painter must be transformed using
5241 QGraphicsItem::sceneTransform().
5242
5243 The \a options parameter is the list of style option objects for
5244 each item in \a items. The \a numItems parameter is the number of
5245 items in \a items and options in \a options. The \a widget
5246 parameter is optional; if specified, it should point to the widget
5247 that is being painted on.
5248
5249 The default implementation prepares the painter matrix, and calls
5250 QGraphicsItem::paint() on all items. Reimplement this function to
5251 provide custom painting of all items for the scene; gaining
5252 complete control over how each item is drawn. In some cases this
5253 can increase drawing performance significantly.
5254
5255 Example:
5256
5257 \snippet graphicssceneadditem/graphicssceneadditemsnippet.cpp 0
5258
5259 Since Qt 4.6, this function is not called anymore unless
5260 the QGraphicsView::IndirectPainting flag is given as an Optimization
5261 flag.
5262
5263 \sa drawBackground(), drawForeground()
5264*/
5265void QGraphicsScene::drawItems(QPainter *painter,
5266 int numItems,
5267 QGraphicsItem *items[],
5268 const QStyleOptionGraphicsItem options[], QWidget *widget)
5269{
5270 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
5271 // Make sure we don't have unpolished items before we draw.
5272 if (!d->unpolishedItems.isEmpty())
5273 d->_q_polishItems();
5274
5275 const qreal opacity = painter->opacity();
5276 QTransform viewTransform = painter->worldTransform();
5277 Q_UNUSED(options);
5278
5279 // Determine view, expose and flags.
5280 QGraphicsView *view = widget ? qobject_cast<QGraphicsView *>(object: widget->parentWidget()) : 0;
5281 QRegion *expose = nullptr;
5282 const quint32 oldRectAdjust = d->rectAdjust;
5283 if (view) {
5284 d->updateAll = false;
5285 expose = &view->d_func()->exposedRegion;
5286 if (view->d_func()->optimizationFlags & QGraphicsView::DontAdjustForAntialiasing)
5287 d->rectAdjust = 1;
5288 else
5289 d->rectAdjust = 2;
5290 }
5291
5292 // Find all toplevels, they are already sorted.
5293 QList<QGraphicsItem *> topLevelItems;
5294 for (int i = 0; i < numItems; ++i) {
5295 QGraphicsItem *item = items[i]->topLevelItem();
5296 if (!item->d_ptr->itemDiscovered) {
5297 topLevelItems << item;
5298 item->d_ptr->itemDiscovered = 1;
5299 d->drawSubtreeRecursive(item, painter, viewTransform: &viewTransform, exposedRegion: expose, widget);
5300 }
5301 }
5302
5303 d->rectAdjust = oldRectAdjust;
5304 // Reset discovery bits.
5305 for (auto topLevelItem : std::as_const(t&: topLevelItems))
5306 topLevelItem->d_ptr->itemDiscovered = 0;
5307
5308 painter->setWorldTransform(matrix: viewTransform);
5309 painter->setOpacity(opacity);
5310}
5311
5312/*!
5313 \since 4.4
5314
5315 Finds a new widget to give the keyboard focus to, as appropriate for Tab
5316 and Shift+Tab, and returns \c true if it can find a new widget, or false if
5317 it cannot. If \a next is true, this function searches forward; if \a next
5318 is false, it searches backward.
5319
5320 You can reimplement this function in a subclass of QGraphicsScene to
5321 provide fine-grained control over how tab focus passes inside your
5322 scene. The default implementation is based on the tab focus chain defined
5323 by QGraphicsWidget::setTabOrder().
5324*/
5325bool QGraphicsScene::focusNextPrevChild(bool next)
5326{
5327 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
5328
5329 QGraphicsItem *item = focusItem();
5330 if (item && !item->isWidget()) {
5331 // Tab out of the scene.
5332 return false;
5333 }
5334 if (!item) {
5335 if (d->lastFocusItem && !d->lastFocusItem->isWidget()) {
5336 // Restore focus to the last focusable non-widget item that had
5337 // focus.
5338 setFocusItem(item: d->lastFocusItem, focusReason: next ? Qt::TabFocusReason : Qt::BacktabFocusReason);
5339 return true;
5340 }
5341 if (d->activePanel) {
5342 if (d->activePanel->flags() & QGraphicsItem::ItemIsFocusable) {
5343 setFocusItem(item: d->activePanel, focusReason: next ? Qt::TabFocusReason : Qt::BacktabFocusReason);
5344 return true;
5345 }
5346 if (d->activePanel->isWidget()) {
5347 QGraphicsWidget *test = static_cast<QGraphicsWidget *>(d->activePanel);
5348 QGraphicsWidget *fw = next ? test->d_func()->focusNext : test->d_func()->focusPrev;
5349 do {
5350 if (fw->focusPolicy() & Qt::TabFocus) {
5351 setFocusItem(item: fw, focusReason: next ? Qt::TabFocusReason : Qt::BacktabFocusReason);
5352 return true;
5353 }
5354 fw = next ? fw->d_func()->focusNext : fw->d_func()->focusPrev;
5355 } while (fw != d->activePanel);
5356 }
5357 }
5358 }
5359 if (!item && !d->tabFocusFirst) {
5360 // No widgets...
5361 return false;
5362 }
5363
5364 // The item must be a widget.
5365 QGraphicsWidget *widget = nullptr;
5366 if (!item) {
5367 widget = next ? d->tabFocusFirst : d->tabFocusFirst->d_func()->focusPrev;
5368 } else {
5369 QGraphicsWidget *test = static_cast<QGraphicsWidget *>(item);
5370 widget = next ? test->d_func()->focusNext : test->d_func()->focusPrev;
5371 if (!widget->panel() && ((next && widget == d->tabFocusFirst) || (!next && widget == d->tabFocusFirst->d_func()->focusPrev))) {
5372 // Tab out of the scene.
5373 return false;
5374 }
5375 }
5376 QGraphicsWidget *widgetThatHadFocus = widget;
5377
5378 // Run around the focus chain until we find a widget that can take tab focus.
5379 do {
5380 if (widget->flags() & QGraphicsItem::ItemIsFocusable
5381 && widget->isEnabled() && widget->isVisibleTo(parent: nullptr)
5382 && (widget->focusPolicy() & Qt::TabFocus)
5383 && (!item || !item->isPanel() || item->isAncestorOf(child: widget))
5384 ) {
5385 setFocusItem(item: widget, focusReason: next ? Qt::TabFocusReason : Qt::BacktabFocusReason);
5386 return true;
5387 }
5388 widget = next ? widget->d_func()->focusNext : widget->d_func()->focusPrev;
5389 if ((next && widget == d->tabFocusFirst) || (!next && widget == d->tabFocusFirst->d_func()->focusPrev))
5390 return false;
5391 } while (widget != widgetThatHadFocus);
5392
5393 return false;
5394}

5416/*!
5417 \fn QGraphicsScene::selectionChanged()
5418 \since 4.3
5419
5420 This signal is emitted by QGraphicsScene whenever the selection
5421 changes. You can call selectedItems() to get the new list of selected
5422 items.
5423
5424 The selection changes whenever an item is selected or unselected, a
5425 selection area is set, cleared or otherwise changed, if a preselected item
5426 is added to the scene, or if a selected item is removed from the scene.
5427
5428 QGraphicsScene emits this signal only once for group selection operations.
5429 For example, if you set a selection area, select or unselect a
5430 QGraphicsItemGroup, or if you add or remove from the scene a parent item
5431 that contains several selected items, selectionChanged() is emitted only
5432 once after the operation has completed (instead of once for each item).
5433
5434 \sa setSelectionArea(), selectedItems(), QGraphicsItem::setSelected()
5435*/
5436
5437/*!
5438 \fn void QGraphicsScene::focusItemChanged(QGraphicsItem *newFocusItem, QGraphicsItem *oldFocusItem, Qt::FocusReason reason)
5439
5440 This signal is emitted by QGraphicsScene whenever focus changes in the
5441 scene (i.e., when an item gains or loses input focus, or when focus
5442 passes from one item to another). You can connect to this signal if you
5443 need to keep track of when other items gain input focus. It is
5444 particularly useful for implementing virtual keyboards, input methods,
5445 and cursor items.
5446
5447 \a oldFocusItem is a pointer to the item that previously had focus, or
5448 0 if no item had focus before the signal was emitted. \a newFocusItem
5449 is a pointer to the item that gained input focus, or \nullptr if focus was lost.
5450 \a reason is the reason for the focus change (e.g., if the scene was
5451 deactivated while an input field had focus, \a oldFocusItem would point
5452 to the input field item, \a newFocusItem would be \nullptr, and \a reason
5453 would be Qt::ActiveWindowFocusReason.
5454*/
5455
5456/*!
5457 \since 4.4
5458
5459 Returns the scene's style, or the same as QApplication::style() if the
5460 scene has not been explicitly assigned a style.
5461
5462 \sa setStyle()
5463*/
5464QStyle *QGraphicsScene::style() const
5465{
5466 Q_D(const QGraphicsScene);
5467 // ### This function, and the use of styles in general, is non-reentrant.
5468 return d->style ? d->style : QApplication::style();
5469}
5470
5471/*!
5472 \since 4.4
5473
5474 Sets or replaces the style of the scene to \a style, and reparents the
5475 style to this scene. Any previously assigned style is deleted. The scene's
5476 style defaults to QApplication::style(), and serves as the default for all
5477 QGraphicsWidget items in the scene.
5478
5479 Changing the style, either directly by calling this function, or
5480 indirectly by calling QApplication::setStyle(), will automatically update
5481 the style for all widgets in the scene that do not have a style explicitly
5482 assigned to them.
5483
5484 If \a style is \nullptr, QGraphicsScene will revert to QApplication::style().
5485
5486 \sa style()
5487*/
5488void QGraphicsScene::setStyle(QStyle *style)
5489{
5490 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
5491 // ### This function, and the use of styles in general, is non-reentrant.
5492 if (style == d->style)
5493 return;
5494
5495 // Delete the old style,
5496 delete d->style;
5497 if ((d->style = style))
5498 d->style->setParent(this);
5499
5500 // Notify the scene.
5501 QEvent event(QEvent::StyleChange);
5502 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: this, event: &event);
5503
5504 // Notify all widgets that don't have a style explicitly set.
5505 const auto items_ = items();
5506 for (QGraphicsItem *item : items_) {
5507 if (item->isWidget()) {
5508 QGraphicsWidget *widget = static_cast<QGraphicsWidget *>(item);
5509 if (!widget->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_SetStyle))
5510 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: widget, event: &event);
5511 }
5512 }
5513}

5515/*!
5516 \property QGraphicsScene::font
5517 \since 4.4
5518 \brief the scene's default font
5519
5520 This property provides the scene's font. The scene font defaults to,
5521 and resolves all its entries from, QApplication::font.
5522
5523 If the scene's font changes, either directly through setFont() or
5524 indirectly when the application font changes, QGraphicsScene first
5525 sends itself a \l{QEvent::FontChange}{FontChange} event, and it then
5526 sends \l{QEvent::FontChange}{FontChange} events to all top-level
5527 widget items in the scene. These items respond by resolving their own
5528 fonts to the scene, and they then notify their children, who again
5529 notify their children, and so on, until all widget items have updated
5530 their fonts.
5531
5532 Changing the scene font, (directly or indirectly through
5533 QApplication::setFont(),) automatically schedules a redraw the entire
5534 scene.
5535
5536 \sa QWidget::font, QApplication::setFont(), palette, style()
5537*/
5538QFont QGraphicsScene::font() const
5539{
5540 Q_D(const QGraphicsScene);
5541 return d->font;
5542}
5543void QGraphicsScene::setFont(const QFont &font)
5544{
5545 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
5546 QFont naturalFont = QApplication::font();
5547 naturalFont.setResolveMask(0);
5548 QFont resolvedFont = font.resolve(naturalFont);
5549 d->setFont_helper(resolvedFont);
5550}

5562 sends itself a \l{QEvent::PaletteChange}{PaletteChange} event, and it then
5563 sends \l{QEvent::PaletteChange}{PaletteChange} events to all top-level
5564 widget items in the scene. These items respond by resolving their own
5565 palettes to the scene, and they then notify their children, who again
5566 notify their children, and so on, until all widget items have updated
5567 their palettes.
5568
5569 Changing the scene palette, (directly or indirectly through
5570 QApplication::setPalette(),) automatically schedules a redraw the entire
5571 scene.
5572

5574*/
5575QPalette QGraphicsScene::palette() const

5648
5649/*!
5650 \since 4.4
5651 Activates \a widget, which must be a widget in this scene. You can also
5652 pass 0 for \a widget, in which case QGraphicsScene will deactivate any
5653 currently active window.
5654
5655 \sa activeWindow(), QGraphicsWidget::isActiveWindow()
5656*/
5657void QGraphicsScene::setActiveWindow(QGraphicsWidget *widget)
5658{
5659 if (widget && widget->scene() != this) {
5660 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsScene::setActiveWindow: widget %p must be part of this scene",
5661 widget);
5662 return;
5663 }
5664
5665 // Activate the widget's panel (all windows are panels).
5666 QGraphicsItem *panel = widget ? widget->panel() : nullptr;
5667 setActivePanel(panel);
5668
5669 // Raise
5670 if (panel) {
5671 QGraphicsItem *parent = panel->parentItem();
5672 // Raise ### inefficient for toplevels
5673
5674 // Find the highest z value.
5675 qreal z = panel->zValue();
5676 const auto siblings = parent ? parent->childItems() : items();
5677 for (QGraphicsItem *sibling : siblings) {
5678 if (sibling != panel && sibling->isWindow())
5679 z = qMax(a: z, b: sibling->zValue());
5680 }
5681
5682 // This will probably never overflow.
5683 const qreal litt = qreal(0.001);
5684 panel->setZValue(z + litt);
5685 }
5686}

5688/*!
5689 \since 4.6
5690
5691 Sends event \a event to item \a item through possible event filters.
5692
5693 The event is sent only if the item is enabled.
5694
5695 Returns \c false if the event was filtered or if the item is disabled.
5696 Otherwise returns the value that was returned from the event handler.
5697
5698 \sa QGraphicsItem::sceneEvent(), QGraphicsItem::sceneEventFilter()
5699*/
5700bool QGraphicsScene::sendEvent(QGraphicsItem *item, QEvent *event)
5701{
5702 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
5703 if (!item) {
5704 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsScene::sendEvent: cannot send event to a null item");
5705 return false;
5706 }
5707 if (item->scene() != this) {
5708 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsScene::sendEvent: item %p's scene (%p)"
5709 " is different from this scene (%p)",
5710 item, item->scene(), this);
5711 return false;
5712 }
5713 return d->sendEvent(item, event);
5714}
5715
5716/*!
5717 \property QGraphicsScene::minimumRenderSize
5718 \since 5.4
5719 \brief the minimal view-transformed size an item must have to be drawn
5720
5721 When the scene is rendered, any item whose width or height, transformed
5722 to the target view, is smaller that minimumRenderSize(), will not be
5723 rendered. If an item is not rendered and it clips its children items
5724 they will also not be rendered. Set this value to speed up rendering
5725 of scenes with many objects rendered on a zoomed out view.
5726
5727 The default value is 0. If unset, or if set to 0 or a negative value,
5728 all items will always be rendered.
5729
5730 For example, setting this property can be especially useful if a scene
5731 is rendered by multiple views, one of which serves as an overview which
5732 always displays all items. In scenes with many items, such a view will
5733 use a high scaling factor so that all items can be shown. Due to the
5734 scaling, smaller items will only make an insignificant contribution to
5735 the final rendered scene. To avoid drawing these items and reduce the
5736 time necessary to render the scene, you can call setMinimumRenderSize()
5737 with a non-negative value.
5738
5739 \note Items that are not drawn as a result of being too small, are still
5740 returned by methods such as items() and itemAt(), and participate in
5741 collision detection and interactions. It is recommended that you set
5742 minimumRenderSize() to a value less than or equal to 1 in order to
5743 avoid large unrendered items that are interactive.
5744
5745 \sa QStyleOptionGraphicsItem::levelOfDetailFromTransform()
5746*/
5747qreal QGraphicsScene::minimumRenderSize() const
5748{
5749 Q_D(const QGraphicsScene);
5750 return d->minimumRenderSize;
5751}
5752void QGraphicsScene::setMinimumRenderSize(qreal minSize)
5753{
5754 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
5755 d->minimumRenderSize = minSize;
5756 update();
5757}
5758
5759/*!
5760 \property QGraphicsScene::focusOnTouch
5761 \since 5.12
5762 \brief whether items gain focus when receiving a \e {touch begin} event.
5763
5764 The usual behavior is to transfer focus only when an item is clicked. Often
5765 a tap on a touchpad is interpreted as equivalent to a mouse click by the
5766 operating system, generating a synthesized click event in response. However,
5767 at least on macOS you can configure this behavior.
5768
5769 By default, QGraphicsScene also transfers focus when you touch on a trackpad
5770 or similar. If the operating system is configured to not generate a
5771 synthetic mouse click on tapping the trackpad, this is surprising. If the
5772 operating system does generate synthetic mouse clicks on tapping the
5773 trackpad, the focus transfer on starting a touch gesture is unnecessary.
5774
5775 With focusOnTouch switched off, QGraphicsScene behaves as one would expect
5776 on macOS.
5777
5778 The default value is \c true, ensuring that the default behavior is just as
5779 in Qt versions prior to 5.12. Set to \c false to prevent touch events from
5780 triggering focus changes.
5781*/
5782bool QGraphicsScene::focusOnTouch() const
5783{
5784 Q_D(const QGraphicsScene);
5785 return d->focusOnTouch;
5786}
5787
5788void QGraphicsScene::setFocusOnTouch(bool enabled)
5789{
5790 Q_D(QGraphicsScene);
5791 d->focusOnTouch = enabled;
5792}
5793
5794void QGraphicsScenePrivate::addView(QGraphicsView *view)
5795{
5796 views << view;
5797#ifndef QT_NO_GESTURES
5798 for (auto it = grabbedGestures.constBegin();
5799 it != grabbedGestures.constEnd(); ++it)
5800 view->viewport()->grabGesture(type: it.key());
5801#endif
5802}
5803
5804void QGraphicsScenePrivate::removeView(QGraphicsView *view)
5805{
5806 views.removeAll(t: view);
5807}
5808
5809void QGraphicsScenePrivate::updateTouchPointsForItem(QGraphicsItem *item, QTouchEvent *touchEvent)
5810{
5811 const QTransform mapFromScene =
5812 item->d_ptr->genericMapFromSceneTransform(viewport: static_cast<const QWidget *>(touchEvent->target()));
5813
5814 for (int i = 0; i < touchEvent->pointCount(); ++i) {
5815 auto &pt = touchEvent->point(i);
5816 QMutableEventPoint::setPosition(p&: pt, arg: mapFromScene.map(p: pt.scenePosition()));
5817 }
5818}
5819
5820int QGraphicsScenePrivate::findClosestTouchPointId(const QPointF &scenePos)
5821{
5822 int closestTouchPointId = -1;
5823 qreal closestDistance = qreal(0.);
5824 for (const QEventPoint &touchPoint : std::as_const(t&: sceneCurrentTouchPoints)) {
5825 qreal distance = QLineF(scenePos, touchPoint.scenePosition()).length();
5826 if (closestTouchPointId == -1|| distance < closestDistance) {
5827 closestTouchPointId = touchPoint.id();
5828 closestDistance = distance;
5829 }
5830 }
5831 return closestTouchPointId;
5832}
5833
5834void QGraphicsScenePrivate::touchEventHandler(QTouchEvent *sceneTouchEvent)
5835{
5836 typedef QPair<QEventPoint::States, QList<QEventPoint> > StatesAndTouchPoints;
5837 QHash<QGraphicsItem *, StatesAndTouchPoints> itemsNeedingEvents;
5838
5839 const auto &touchPoints = sceneTouchEvent->points();
5840 for (const auto &touchPoint : touchPoints) {
5841 // update state
5842 QGraphicsItem *item = nullptr;
5843 if (touchPoint.state() == QEventPoint::State::Pressed) {
5844 if (sceneTouchEvent->pointingDevice()->type() == QInputDevice::DeviceType::TouchPad) {
5845 // on touch-pad devices, send all touch points to the same item
5846 item = itemForTouchPointId.isEmpty()
5847 ? 0
5848 : itemForTouchPointId.constBegin().value();
5849 }
5850
5851 if (!item) {
5852 // determine which item this touch point will go to
5853 cachedItemsUnderMouse = itemsAtPosition(screenPos: touchPoint.globalPosition().toPoint(),
5854 scenePos: touchPoint.scenePosition(),
5855 widget: static_cast<QWidget *>(sceneTouchEvent->target()));
5856 item = cachedItemsUnderMouse.isEmpty() ? 0 : cachedItemsUnderMouse.constFirst();
5857 }
5858
5859 if (sceneTouchEvent->pointingDevice()->type() == QInputDevice::DeviceType::TouchScreen) {
5860 // on touch-screens, combine this touch point with the closest one we find
5861 int closestTouchPointId = findClosestTouchPointId(scenePos: touchPoint.scenePosition());
5862 QGraphicsItem *closestItem = itemForTouchPointId.value(key: closestTouchPointId);
5863 if (!item || (closestItem && cachedItemsUnderMouse.contains(t: closestItem)))
5864 item = closestItem;
5865 }
5866 if (!item)
5867 continue;
5868
5869 itemForTouchPointId.insert(key: touchPoint.id(), value: item);
5870 sceneCurrentTouchPoints.insert(key: touchPoint.id(), value: touchPoint);
5871 } else if (touchPoint.state() == QEventPoint::State::Released) {
5872 item = itemForTouchPointId.take(key: touchPoint.id());
5873 if (!item)
5874 continue;
5875
5876 sceneCurrentTouchPoints.remove(key: touchPoint.id());
5877 } else {
5878 item = itemForTouchPointId.value(key: touchPoint.id());
5879 if (!item)
5880 continue;
5881 Q_ASSERT(sceneCurrentTouchPoints.contains(touchPoint.id()));
5882 sceneCurrentTouchPoints[touchPoint.id()] = touchPoint;
5883 }
5884
5885 StatesAndTouchPoints &statesAndTouchPoints = itemsNeedingEvents[item];
5886 statesAndTouchPoints.first = QEventPoint::States(statesAndTouchPoints.first | touchPoint.state());
5887 statesAndTouchPoints.second.append(t: touchPoint);
5888 }
5889
5890 if (itemsNeedingEvents.isEmpty()) {
5891 sceneTouchEvent->ignore();
5892 return;
5893 }
5894
5895 bool ignoreSceneTouchEvent = true;
5896 QHash<QGraphicsItem *, StatesAndTouchPoints>::ConstIterator it = itemsNeedingEvents.constBegin();
5897 const QHash<QGraphicsItem *, StatesAndTouchPoints>::ConstIterator end = itemsNeedingEvents.constEnd();
5898 for (; it != end; ++it) {
5899 QGraphicsItem *item = it.key();
5900
5901 (void) item->isBlockedByModalPanel(blockingPanel: &item);
5902
5903 // determine event type from the state mask
5904 QEvent::Type eventType;
5905 switch (it.value().first) {
5906 case QEventPoint::State::Pressed:
5907 // all touch points have pressed state
5908 eventType = QEvent::TouchBegin;
5909 break;
5910 case QEventPoint::State::Released:
5911 // all touch points have released state
5912 eventType = QEvent::TouchEnd;
5913 break;
5914 case QEventPoint::State::Stationary:
5915 // don't send the event if nothing changed
5916 continue;
5917 default:
5918 // all other combinations
5919 eventType = QEvent::TouchUpdate;
5920 break;
5921 }
5922
5923 QMutableTouchEvent touchEvent(eventType, sceneTouchEvent->pointingDevice(), sceneTouchEvent->modifiers(), it.value().second);
5924 touchEvent.setTarget(sceneTouchEvent->target());
5925 touchEvent.setModifiers(sceneTouchEvent->modifiers());
5926 touchEvent.setTimestamp(sceneTouchEvent->timestamp());
5927
5928 switch (touchEvent.type()) {
5929 case QEvent::TouchBegin:
5930 {
5931 // if the TouchBegin handler recurses, we assume that means the event
5932 // has been implicitly accepted and continue to send touch events
5933 item->d_ptr->acceptedTouchBeginEvent = true;
5934 bool res = sendTouchBeginEvent(item, touchEvent: &touchEvent) && touchEvent.isAccepted();
5935 if (!res) {
5936 // forget about these touch points, we didn't handle them
5937 const auto &unhandledTouchPoints = touchEvent.points();
5938 for (const auto &touchPoint : unhandledTouchPoints) {
5939 itemForTouchPointId.remove(key: touchPoint.id());
5940 sceneCurrentTouchPoints.remove(key: touchPoint.id());
5941 }
5942 ignoreSceneTouchEvent = false;
5943 }
5944 break;
5945 }
5946 default:
5947 if (item->d_ptr->acceptedTouchBeginEvent) {
5948 updateTouchPointsForItem(item, touchEvent: &touchEvent);
5949 (void) sendEvent(item, event: &touchEvent);
5950 ignoreSceneTouchEvent = false;
5951 }
5952 break;
5953 }
5954 }
5955 // don't override the acceptance state of the individual points
5956 sceneTouchEvent->QInputEvent::setAccepted(ignoreSceneTouchEvent);
5957}
5958
5959bool QGraphicsScenePrivate::sendTouchBeginEvent(QGraphicsItem *origin, QTouchEvent *touchEvent)
5960{
5961 Q_Q(QGraphicsScene);
5962
5963 if (focusOnTouch) {
5964 if (cachedItemsUnderMouse.isEmpty() || cachedItemsUnderMouse.constFirst() != origin) {
5965 const QEventPoint &firstTouchPoint = touchEvent->points().first();
5966 cachedItemsUnderMouse = itemsAtPosition(screenPos: firstTouchPoint.globalPosition().toPoint(),
5967 scenePos: firstTouchPoint.scenePosition(),
5968 widget: static_cast<QWidget *>(touchEvent->target()));
5969 }
5970
5971 // Set focus on the topmost enabled item that can take focus.
5972 bool setFocus = false;
5973
5974 for (QGraphicsItem *item : std::as_const(t&: cachedItemsUnderMouse)) {
5975 if (item->isEnabled() && ((item->flags() & QGraphicsItem::ItemIsFocusable) && item->d_ptr->mouseSetsFocus)) {
5976 if (!item->isWidget() || ((QGraphicsWidget *)item)->focusPolicy() & Qt::ClickFocus) {
5977 setFocus = true;
5978 if (item != q->focusItem())
5979 q->setFocusItem(item, focusReason: Qt::MouseFocusReason);
5980 break;
5981 }
5982 }
5983 if (item->isPanel())
5984 break;
5985 if (item->d_ptr->flags & QGraphicsItem::ItemStopsClickFocusPropagation)
5986 break;
5987 if (item->d_ptr->flags & QGraphicsItem::ItemStopsFocusHandling) {
5988 // Make sure we don't clear focus.
5989 setFocus = true;
5990 break;
5991 }
5992 }
5993
5994 // If nobody could take focus, clear it.
5995 if (!stickyFocus && !setFocus)
5996 q->setFocusItem(item: nullptr, focusReason: Qt::MouseFocusReason);
5997 }
5998
5999 bool res = false;
6000 bool eventAccepted = touchEvent->isAccepted();
6001 for (QGraphicsItem *item : std::as_const(t&: cachedItemsUnderMouse)) {
6002 // first, try to deliver the touch event
6003 updateTouchPointsForItem(item, touchEvent);
6004 bool acceptTouchEvents = item->acceptTouchEvents();
6005 touchEvent->setAccepted(acceptTouchEvents);
6006 res = acceptTouchEvents && sendEvent(item, event: touchEvent);
6007 eventAccepted = touchEvent->isAccepted();
6008 if (itemForTouchPointId.value(key: touchEvent->points().first().id()) == 0) {
6009 // item was deleted
6010 item = nullptr;
6011 } else {
6012 item->d_ptr->acceptedTouchBeginEvent = (res && eventAccepted);
6013 }
6014 touchEvent->m_spont = false;
6015 if (res && eventAccepted) {
6016 // the first item to accept the TouchBegin gets an implicit grab.
6017 const auto &touchPoints = touchEvent->points();
6018 for (const auto &touchPoint : touchPoints)
6019 itemForTouchPointId[touchPoint.id()] = item; // can be zero
6020 break;
6021 }
6022 if (item && item->isPanel())
6023 break;
6024 }
6025
6026 // don't override the acceptance state of the touch points
6027 touchEvent->QInputEvent::setAccepted(eventAccepted);
6028 return res;
6029}

6031void QGraphicsScenePrivate::enableTouchEventsOnViews()
6032{
6033 for (QGraphicsView *view : std::as_const(t&: views))
6034 view->viewport()->setAttribute(Qt::WA_AcceptTouchEvents, on: true);
6035}

6037void QGraphicsScenePrivate::updateInputMethodSensitivityInViews()

6040 view->d_func()->updateInputMethodSensitivity();
